4:45.going_detailed: SOFT, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.0)

runners.name: Scarboroughwarning
runners.comment: 1-1 on turf and showed improved form on AW since; respectable comeback last week; player
runners.spotlight: Won a Catterick novice (6f, soft) in September, her only start on turf; improved form in AW handicaps subsequently, winning at Wolverhampton before a good second at Southwell (both 6f in October); respectable comeback third at Kempton eight days ago and she's open to further progress back on turf.

runners.name: Dashing Dick
runners.comment: Tailed off on his return but bounced back latest; has gone well here before; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Made all for both 6f wins (good and good to firm); still 3lb higher than for the latest of them last July but bounced back from a tailed-off reappearance in April with a respectable sixth of 12 (Arnaz last) at Ascot this month; tends to go well here and should be in the mix.

runners.name: Expert Agent
runners.comment: May be best with time between runs so not sure to build on solid return; still respected
runners.spotlight: Much of last year was bitterly disappointing but he popped up at Windsor (6f, good) in July, after a 65-day break, and ran well on his comeback at Kempton (6f, AW) 22 days ago; might be best with space between his races, so isn't guaranteed to build on that, but possibilities even so.

runners.name: Arnaz
runners.comment: Hasn't added to a winning handicap debut; good return but flopped next time; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Made a winning handicap debut at Brighton (7f, good) a year ago but hasn't been able to add to it, despite regular market support; narrowly denied at Haydock (6f, good) on his April return but again let his backers down when 5-4 favourite and last of twelve at Ascot this month (6f, good to firm; Dashing Dick sixth); quick ground was a possible excuse.

runners.name: Dark Side Thunder
runners.comment: 0-12 on turf but often goes well here; good course third latest and should go well again
runners.spotlight: 0-12 on turf but he can operate on this surface and ran well when third here (7f, good to firm) 15 days ago; not the first time he's put in a good shift at this track and he's becoming quite well treated.

runners.name: Havana Sky
runners.comment: Rampant on AW at the end of last year; not ruled out on this comeback and return to turf
runners.spotlight: Won a Thirsk classified (6f, good to firm) last August; rampant on AW at the end of last year, winning five in a row over 6f, but went off the boil in three subsequent runs; needs to get back in the groove on this comeback and return to turf, but that's not out of the question.

stable_tour.quote: He was my all-weather winter horse. He won six races last year but then got an injury. He won horse of the month in December, getting a rather nice bonus, and had a two-month holiday after January. He's just started back in cantering and I'm looking forward to seeing him back on the turf. He's a 6f/7f horse and is owned by a great group of people who love him. 30-04-25

runners.name: Rhythmic Acclaim
runners.comment: Dual 6f course winner; below par latest but possibilities if that can be forgiven
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f course winner; runner-up here (6f, good) and at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) last month but below her best when favourite and only sixth of eight at this track (7f, good to firm; Dark Side Thunder third) 15 days ago; possibilities if that can be forgiven.

4:10.race_name: Winning Experience With Moulton Racing Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
4:10.going_detailed: SOFT, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.0)

runners.name: Spinning Wheel
runners.comment: The horse he beat at Beverley (1m2f, good) won this week at Redcar; penalised
runners.spotlight: The horse he beat at Beverley (1m2f, good; front two clear) won this week at Redcar (odds-on); this step up in trip should suit but the penalty asks a question of him.

runners.name: Caughtredhanded
runners.comment: Positive run in the Wood Ditton but ran miserably next time and now in headgear
runners.spotlight: Positives to take out of his never-dangerous fifth in the Wood Ditton (1m, good) but he ran miserably at Newbury (1m2f, good) and now goes in headgear; Marnier is probably the yard's main hope here.

runners.name: Marnier
runners.comment: First run was better than the second, though perhaps he failed to handle Chester
runners.spotlight: Out of unraced daughter of a 1m2f Group 1 Nassau winner; slow to break in both his races (at about 1m2f) but stayed on takingly behind Derby contender Gethin at Newbury and perhaps didn't handle Chester next time; remains promising.

runners.name: Savvy Stellar
runners.comment: Has the least convincing form claims after two heavy defeats and one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Has the least convincing form claims after two heavy defeats and one for handicaps.

runners.name: Sharp Move
runners.comment: First foal out of 6f 2yo winner (92) and half-sister to 2m Listed winner Nate The Great
runners.spotlight: First foal out of a 6f 2yo winner (RPR 92) and half-sister to 2m Listed winner Nate The Great; the only runner who lacks experience but would command maximum respect if at all strong in the betting.

2:40.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
2:40.going_detailed: SOFT, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.0)

runners.name: Brave Hunter
runners.comment: Universal colt who's a brother to a 1m4f winner; likely one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: By Universal; third foal; brother to 1m4f winner Minhad (RPR 82); dam 7f June 2yo winner (third start; 82), closely related to 7f winner Queen's Course, out of 6f 2yo Group 3/Norwegian 1,000 Guineas winner Dingle View; stable has few winning 2yos first time out and he's probably one for further down the line.

runners.name: Commanders Intent
runners.breeder: S A S Haute Vallee, Mme Moa Sundstrom
runners.comment: Not disgraced on debut when 11th of 18 at Newbury (6f, good) 13 days ago; should improve
runners.spotlight: 420,000euros yearling; Victor Ludorum colt; dam well beaten in France, half-sister to French winner Lilac Fairy (1m 2yo Listed) out of French 9.5f/1m2f 2yo scorer; slowly away but wasn't disgraced when 11th of 18 in a 6f Newbury maiden (good; 16-1) 13 days ago, when he didn't see much daylight; longer trip will probably help and he should know more this time.

runners.name: Man Of Vision
runners.comment: Dubawi colt with a fine pedigree; looks another likely newcomer for his powerful yard
runners.spotlight: By Dubawi; first foal; dam 6f-1m1f winner (including her first two 2yo starts/Group 2), half-sister to winners Rizeena (Coronation/Moyglare Stud Stakes) and Regal Honour (7f 2yo), out of 7f 2yo winning half-sister to 1m1f Group 1 winner Zabeel Prince; yard is having a fine time with juveniles and he could be its latest winning newcomer.

runners.name: On The Inlet
runners.comment: 160,000gns yearling related to winning juveniles; market can guide on this debut
runners.spotlight: 160,000gns yearling by New Bay; seventh foal; brother to two winners inc Jumby (6f/7f including 2yo July debut/Group 3; RPR 116), half-brother to four winners including Conflict (6f-1m; 99) and Jump The Gun (6f-1m including 2yo; 98); dam Group-placed 6f 2yo winner (second start; 102); yard is 2-7 with juveniles this year.

runners.name: Rodeo
runners.breeder: Lady Bamford & The Hon Alice Bamford
runners.comment: Newcomer; US turf family; excellent yard enjoys plenty of 2yo success here
runners.spotlight: By St Mark's Basilica; third foal; half-brother to winners American Arrow (7f; RPR 93) and Heron Bay (US 1m turf); dam US 6.5f-1m1f turf winner (including 2yo/Grade 2; 100), half-sister to US 8.5f Grade 2 winner Harvest Moon, out of US 1m1f Grade 3 winner; excellent yard enjoys plenty of 2yo success here and their juveniles were off the mark for 2025 with a heavily backed filly (second time out) at Kempton yesterday.

runners.name: Velocity Vow
runners.comment: 140,000gns Camelot yearling; might be one for further next year but yard can ready one
runners.spotlight: 140,000gns yearling by Camelot; first foal; dam French 10.5f winner, sister to useful French/German 1m-1m2f winner Spiorad, out of 6f 2yo (September debut) winning half-sister to 6f Group 3 winner Lightning Moon; immediate family points to next year over further but his yard can ready one and the market should be informative.

3:40.going_detailed: SOFT, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.0)

runners.name: Forca Timao
runners.comment: Only beat three rivals at Southwell and that race fell apart; back up 7lb
runners.spotlight: Snapped a losing run when comfortably beating three rivals over 1m3f at Southwell (AW); that might be dodgy form and has gone back up 7lb.

quotes.race: Parliament Square EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Forca Timao was very good, we have always held him in nice regard. He has improved a lot from his first run and will improve again. He is a lovely colt going forward - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I couldn't believe how moderately he ran first time out at Sandown last year, but after a break he won well as the 40-1 outsider of the field at Doncaster over seven furlongs. He's as handsome a horse as you'll see and I think he'll make up into a very useful colt at around a mile and a quarter. 02-05-23

runners.name: Didaar
runners.comment: Chance if forgiven latest flop and there were excuses but soft ground a worry
runners.spotlight: Threatened in a 1m2f novice on fast ground; gelded ahead of his encouraging return at Redcar (1m2f handicap, good) and reportedly suffering from an irregular heartbeat when tailed off at Salisbury.

runners.name: Sir Edward Lear
runners.comment: Lightly raced and just missed out on handicap debut at Windsor; might not want soft ground
runners.spotlight: Watch the weather as the blip in his profile came on soft ground; had the run of things when just missing out on handicap debut at Windsor (1m2f, good to firm) but there are races in him off this mark.

quotes.race: Harrogate Theatre Panto Tickets Now On-Sale Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a lovely introduction. I've never been to Ripon before but I had a walk round and it's quite undulating. Sir Edward Lear was learning on the job, Sean gave him a lovely ride - James Owen, trainer.

runners.name: Woodstock City

prev_owners.owner: Gl Racing, Ecurie Normandy Spirit & J-P-J Dubois
O Gonzalez Lozano, Ecurie Normandy Spirit & J-P-J Dubois

runners.comment: Probably in fair form as ran well for a long way at Chester until stretched by 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Only 1-17 since arriving in Britain but the win came off a similar mark and, with a run under his belt, he ran well at Chester until fading away over the extended 1m4f; this trip seems a better fit; best British form on good or faster but had easy-ground form in France.

runners.name: Show Biz Kid
runners.comment: Might not want the ground to ease too much but solid chance otherwise
runners.spotlight: Only went up 2lb for narrow C&D win on good ground last month and again ran well at Pontefract behind one who dominated up front; might not want the ground to ease too much but solid chance otherwise.

runners.name: Charming Whisper
runners.owner: Exors Of Serafino Agodino & P J Mcbride
runners.comment: Modest last run but too well handicapped to ignore and worth another go over this far
runners.spotlight: Still some way beneath his peak form but ran better to be fifth of 16 at Chelmsford (1m) only to then finish well beaten at Newmarket; too well handicapped to ignore, though, and worth another go over this far; goes on all ground.

quotes.race: Country & Town House Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: The handicapper can't put Charming Whisper up too much and he's always been a nice little horse. He was fresh and boiled over a little bit first time out and he can get a bit warm. He's learning - Charlie McBride, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Juddmonte EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C and D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Charming Whisper was very cheap through the sales ring because he was a rig. We had to take him home and bring him to Rossdales [Newmarket vet surgeons] to have an operation, but he hasn't looked back ever since. I actually didn't realise what a valuable race it was, but it is terrific to pick up this prize-money with such a cheaply bought horse. I think all the owners backed him at 50-1 too! - Charlie McBride, trainer.

runners.name: Saturn Five
runners.comment: Did all his best work late at Chester and now on a more galloping track
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced since winning as a 3yo in Ireland; three solid runs this season following a long absence, last time at Chester doing all his best work late (extended 1m2f, good); would have something to prove on softening ground but looks a big player on this galloping track.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: Saturn Five is tough and hardy, he's a big horse and still green. There should be a lot of improvement in him. Hopefully he is one for next year and that trip is probably his minimum - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He joined us from Joseph O'Brien this spring having won a 1m1f maiden at Punchestown in the autumn. We had a little sighter with him first time out at Newbury last month over 1m2f on hock-deep ground and I thought he went okay, but he got the race the wrong way round. He is a real stayer with a future and off his current mark, which has been dropped 2lb since last time, he is one to keep on your side. I gave him his second run back last week at York over two furlongs further where he finished seventh. 28-05-23

runners.name: Obsidian Knight
runners.comment: Made it 0-12 on turf when a long way behind at Chester, finishing adrift of Woodstock City
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner on the AW but made it 0-12 on turf when a long way behind at Chester, finishing adrift of Woodstock City.

quotes.race: Huge Daily Boosts Only At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Obsidian Knight has won round here three times now but I wouldn't say he has to come here. What he needs is a proper gallop, and he got one today. We're looking forward to running him on the turf, but whether we give him a break or go for one of the bonuses, I'll speak to the owners and see what they want to do. He seems to handle the track lovely and Tom gave him an absolutely perfect ride - Terry Kent, trainer.

runners.name: Corundum
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs A E Pakenham
runners.comment: 0-6 but was only 2l away at Newcastle (1m2f AW) last time when unsuited by track position
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but was only 2l away at Newcastle (1m2f AW) last time when unsuited by track position; two new forms of headgear now added; respected.

stable_tour.quote: He has started fast work and should be out on the Flat in April. He hasn't won yet but was second on his final run last year and is rated 73. He's a big gelding who'll improve for a bit of maturity. He'd be my dark horse. 19-03-25

runners.name: Dark Lyric
runners.comment: Quiet reappearance after a solid last season; stamina to prove as unraced beyond 8.6f
runners.spotlight: Promising runs last year at 7f and 1m; her least effective performance yet was on Lingfield return (7f), albeit in a valuable Class 4; unraced beyond 8.6f and pedigree doesn't shout stamina.

runners.name: Solar Saving
runners.comment: Good debut in Ireland but failed to progress; sold on for 4,000gns; had three races
runners.spotlight: Close up behind a smart horse when third on debut in a 1m Navan maiden but well beaten in his next two races and left Jim Bolger for 4,000gns; makes stable/handicap debut after quite an absence and can only be watched.

runners.name: Solanna
runners.comment: Yet another good run at Kempton last time (1m4f) but he is a C&D winner
runners.spotlight: Yet another good run at Kempton last time (1m4f) and he is a C&D winner who has been likeably consistent in the last year; fair shout.

stable_tour.quote: He got the season off to a fantastic start by winning three races on the bounce, which saw his rating shoot up from 47 to 68. I then made the mistake of giving him time off to strengthen up and I haven't been happy with his last three runs. I expected a big show at Wolverhampton last time but he was mid-division. I've been happy with him at home of late and I think you'll see a different horse next time. 23-09-22

runners.name: Lechuga Lad
runners.comment: Surely failed to stay the 1m6f last time but can race keenly and comes with risks
runners.spotlight: Close up on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (9.4f; only time he's not worn a hood in last five races) but well beaten since then over 1m2f and 1m6f; surely failed to stay last time but can race keenly and comes with risks.

runners.name: Coolree
runners.comment: Responded well for pressure to get the job done at Beverley; up 4lb in a deeper race
runners.spotlight: Responded well for pressure to get the job done at Beverley (extended 1m, good) where today's headgear combination returned; won't mind returning to this far but he is 4lb higher in what looks a deeper race.

5:20.race_name: Download The At The Races App Handicap
5:20.going_detailed: SOFT, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.0)

runners.name: Giorgio M
runners.comment: Only just missed out here last week; ground easier than good would be a first
runners.spotlight: Both wins over 7f, on good ground and AW; ground easier than good would be a first for him but he only just missed out here last week.

runners.name: Silver Trumpet
runners.comment: Three wins last year and hasn't been running too badly back from a break
runners.spotlight: Won three 7f handicaps last year from February to May and only 4lb higher than for the latest; hasn't been running too badly back from a break and suffered interference latest when in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Drifts Away
runners.comment: Another good run at Kempton (1m; fine at 7f) behind one who looked very well handicapped
runners.spotlight: All his improvement has come on the AW but surely a better horse now then when he was last seen on turf; another good run at Kempton (1m; fine at 7f) behind one who looked very well handicapped; soft ground would be an unknown.

runners.name: Flag Of St George
runners.comment: 2yo winner who is 0-9 in handicaps but has not been far away in the last five
runners.spotlight: 2yo winner who is 0-9 in handicaps but has not been far away in the last five, latterly placed in the new blinkers at Newmarket (7f, good to firm; bit to prove on softer); thereabouts.

runners.name: Bella Bisbee
runners.comment: Encouraging fourth here on her return from a break and that was in a fast-run race
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner, at 6f, 7f and 1m; encouraging fourth here on her return from a break and that was in a fast-run race; considered; ground easier than good to soft could be troublesome.

runners.name: Bluebells Boy
runners.comment: Last year went well with five wins all told and he continued to run well up to December
runners.spotlight: Last year went well with five wins all told and he continued to run well up to December; still doesn't look unrealistically treated and kicks off for new trainer after wind surgery.

runners.name: Cancan In The Rain
runners.comment: Dual winner who was unlucky not to win something last year; now with a new yard
runners.spotlight: Won a C&D novice at two for Chris Dwyer and the following year added a Newmarket handicap (1m) for Charlie Johnston; bit unlucky not to win again last season but left previous yard after a below par AW run in November and likely best watched on this stable debut.

runners.name: Gdaay
runners.comment: Continues to give the impression that career win number eight might be around the corner
runners.spotlight: Continues to give the impression that career win number eight might be around the corner off his reduced mark; each-way claims provided conditions don't turn too soft.

runners.name: Onemorenomore
runners.comment: Still looked in fair form when third at Newmarket recently; rain would help
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been at Doncaster and still looked in fair form when third at Newmarket recently (7f, good); dropped 2lb for that and rain would increase his chances.

quotes.race: Thank You To Doncaster Annual Members Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Onemorenomore is a jockey's dream, he's very straightforward - just switch him off early and try not to get there too soon - Billy Loughnane, jockey.

quotes.race: Grace And Dotty Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I thought Onemorenomore was too far back, I thought he was never going to get there. But he did exactly the same thing here last year, just getting there on the nod in the last 20 yards. He's that type of horse, we ride him behind at home and he always finishes off his gallops. The way he ran, he'll probably get a mile. He's declared for Southwell on Sunday and there's no reason why he shouldn't run. He takes his galloping well, he's a nice big horse -  Philip McBride, trainer.

2:10.going_detailed: SOFT, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.0)

runners.name: Crowd Quake
runners.comment: Won two of his last three; sharp drop in trip not ideal but at least he's in form; player
runners.spotlight: Sharp improvement since switched to turf and upped in trip, winning twice at Windsor (1m2f) this month and finishing second over 1m4f at Leicester (also good to firm; kept on well) on Monday; in-form gelding who's probably the most likely winner but this drop back in trip does pose a question.

runners.name: Al Shabab
runners.comment: 19-race maiden who's been expensive to follow on AW; not the percentage call back up to 1m
runners.spotlight: 19-race maiden who's been expensive to follow on AW (mostly at 7f) this winter and was again prominent in the market when ninth of 11 at Wolverhampton on his return this month; probably not the percentage call back up to 1m on turf.

runners.name: United Force
runners.comment: 1lb lower than when winning over C&D last July; solid latest; might be the answer
runners.spotlight: 1lb lower than when winning over C&D last July; picked up a couple of AW handicaps since and his latest third behind a wide-margin winner at Southwell (also 1m) was a respectable effort; might be the answer.

runners.name: Specialist View
runners.owner: Strawberry Fields Stud And Mrs S Dwyer
runners.comment: Sole win came on AW; might have needed latest run and she's not totally ruled out
runners.spotlight: Sole win came on AW; her two turf runs don't feature among her better efforts but she was sent off favourite in a first-time tongue tie when sixth to United Force over C&D in July, after which she had wind surgery; might have needed her latest outing when sixth at Southwell (1m; United Force third) after 274 days away.

runners.name: Pending Appeal
runners.owner: Dr M Voikhansky & Mrs S Voikhanskaya
runners.comment: Latest second in a classified (AW) was better; needs to build on that now back on turf
runners.spotlight: Fair 6f/7f performer for Charles Hills in 2022/2023 but nothing to show in five turf runs for new stable last year (all big prices); latest second was much more like it, though, when dropped into a classified at Wolverhampton (8.5f, AW; 33-1) in March; needs to build on that now back on turf.

quotes.race: Fairfax Saddles Grassroots Series Final Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I spent most of the middle part of the race taking a pull on Pending Appeal and trying to fill her up. She's a quick filly and I maybe went 50 yards too soon, but she just did enough to hold on. Six furlongs is her limit at this stage and the nice ground suited her well - David Egan, jockey.

runners.name: Edvard Grieg

prev_owners.owner: G Brooks & James Sweeney & Jack Thomas

runners.comment: Sprinting backfired latest; respectable efforts around this trip previously; thereabouts
runners.spotlight: 0-14 but his two efforts on good and good to firm in April (around 1m) were respectable; blinkers and drop to sprinting backfired last time but should do better now back up in trip; career-low mark and tongue tie goes on.

runners.name: Kessaar Power

prev_owners.owner: Paul Kwok, Angel Li & Orbital Racing Group

runners.comment: Not beaten far last time (7f, AW) and he goes off the same mark; turf and trip fine
runners.spotlight: 1-13 on turf but the win did come here (6f, soft) just over two years ago; some respectable efforts on AW this year, including when beaten 2l at Chelmsford (7f) one week ago; stays this trip and goes off the same mark.

runners.name: Create
runners.owner: Dixon, Wylam, M Baldry, J&S Harrod
runners.comment: Has run well the last twice and should do so again but needs to confirm a mile still suits
runners.spotlight: 1-8 on turf, the win coming at Doncaster (7f, good) last July; running moderately on AW since December until a close third at Southwell last month and backed that up when second at Doncaster (also 7f, good to firm) 23 days later; needs to confirm she stays a mile but should go well again.

runners.name: Heers Sadie
runners.comment: Backward step last time at a track she generally goes well at; that raises a question
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden handicap over 6f here in 2021; okay return at Brighton (1m) last month but she took a step backwards over that C&D (also good to firm) 17 days later; generally goes well there so has questions to answer now.

runners.name: Fast Flo
runners.comment: 38-race maiden who has finished down the field the last twice; passed over
runners.spotlight: 38-race maiden who has finished down the field the last twice and was beaten a particularly long way at Leicester on Tuesday; four of her top seven RPRs have come here but she's still hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Almizan
runners.comment: Unexposed and her last run was her best one; turf should be fine; interesting
runners.spotlight: Nibbled at in the market when fifth of ten at Wolverhampton (8.5f, AW; 18-1) 17 days ago; that was her best effort and only her second handicap, so there might be more to come; pedigree suggests turf should be fine.

runners.name: Primrose Maid
runners.comment: Tailed off last time and can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Last three runs have been alarming, latterly when tailed off here (7f) last month; can only be watched.

3:10.race_name: Weekend Winners On At The Races Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
3:10.going_detailed: SOFT, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 5.0)

runners.name: Showering
runners.comment: Won on debut and good second next time; jointly sets the standard; turf debut/reappearance
runners.spotlight: Won going away on his December debut and only found a well-backed newcomer too good (also Newcastle, 6f) 22 days later; sets the standard alongside Miss Cartesian; big player on turf debut/reappearance.

runners.name: Atmosphere
runners.comment: Similar form at big prices in a maiden and novice (6f, AW); watching brief on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Similar form at big prices in a Kempton novice and maiden (both 6f, AW) recently; now hooded and best watched on this turf debut.

runners.name: Miss Cartesian
runners.owner: G C Myddelton & V E C Taylor
runners.comment: 1-1 and jointly sets the standard on that; big player on this turf debut/reappearance
runners.spotlight: From the family of Modern Games (multiple 1m Group/Grade 1s) and Mawj (1,000 Guineas and US 1m1f Grade 1); strong in the market and overcame early greenness, finishing off well to make a winning debut at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) in November; could be anything and sets the standard alongside Showering on this return; turf debut.

runners.name: Sprinter
runners.comment: Beaten over 20l in a maiden and novice (6f, AW; big prices); can only watch on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Beaten just over 20l at big prices in a Kempton novice and maiden (both 6f, AW) recently; can only be watched on his turf debut.

runners.name: Cocooned
runners.comment: Some promise on recent debut (7f, AW); can chase the big two home on this turf debut
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to seven winners including Farhh To Shy (6f-1m; RPR 100) and Shyron (6f-1m; 97); some promise on debut when fifth of nine at Kempton (7f, AW; 66-1) 22 days ago but will probably be more at home once handicapping; drops to 6f for this turf debut.

runners.name: Neyvas Angel
runners.comment: Harry Angel filly from a yard with a modest record in this type of race; best watched
runners.spotlight: By Harry Angel; fifth foal; half-sister to winners Madame Ellingtina (UAE 7f dirt; RPR 82) and Kalma (1m2f turf/1m4f AW, 77; 2m hurdle); dam placed 6f 2yo (62); yard not noted for success in maidens/novices and she's best watched on this introduction unless the market says otherwise.

4:00.race_name: Nicholls & Clarke 150th Year Anniversary Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
4:00.going_detailed: POLYTRACK: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Bradshaw
runners.comment: Has shown little in five starts and looks one for handicaps; drops in trip
runners.spotlight: Has shown little in five starts (Flat/hurdles) and now drops in distance; probably one for handicaps.

runners.name: Gregorians Star
runners.comment: Won a Ludlow bumper in November; well beaten at Uttoxexter last time; best watched
runners.spotlight: Won a Ludlow bumper on good ground in November and wasn't beaten far when third over hurdles at Kempton last month; beat only one rival home at Uttoxeter since and makes his Flat debut with the recent tongue-tie removed; best watched.

runners.name: Sea Poetry
runners.comment: Won on debut and posted another good effort on return at Kempton on AW; strong claims
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut when well backed at Newmarket (7f, good to soft) in November and posted another good effort to finish second of 14 when switched to AW at Kempton (7f; drawn wide) on her return; gives the penalty away returned to turf but she sets the standard on ratings.

stable_tour.quote: She has a beautiful pedigree. Owen hasn't done a huge amount with her yet but she has the looks to be a good filly in due course. 02-08-24

runners.name: Elarak
runners.comment: Shaped with encouragement when sixth on debut at Newmarket in October; open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Kingman colt who shaped with encouragement when slow-starting sixth of 12 on debut at Newmarket (7f, good to soft; 18-1) in October; now encounters quicker ground having been off since but he's open to progress.

runners.name: Headmaster
runners.comment: Dubawi gelding; dam is three-time Prix de la Foret winner One Master; one to note on debut
runners.spotlight: Dubawi gelding; first foal; dam 6f-7.4f winner One Master (including Group 1 Prix de la Foret three times; RPR 118), closely related to winners Triple Chocolate (6f/7f), Arousing (6f) and Craved (6f); one to note in the betting on debut.

runners.name: The Bellhop
runners.comment: Made 15,000euros as yearling; Belardo gelding; dam 1m4f winner (RPR 90); watch the betting
runners.spotlight: Made 15,000euros as a yearling; Belardo gelding; first foal; dam 1m4f winner (RPR 90), half-sister to winners Anner Castle (1m4f), Fumata (1m4f) and Lion City (bumper); watch the market on debut.

runners.name: Travel Agent
runners.comment: Showed plenty of ability at Kempton on debut in October after a slow start; gelded since
runners.spotlight: Son of No Nay Never and cost 200,000gns as a yearling; weak 9-1, showed plenty of ability when sixth of 14 after slow start from his wide stall at Kempton (7f, AW) in October; switches to turf having been gelded since and has to be respected.

runners.name: What A Recovery
runners.comment: 80-1 and didn't show much at Leicester (7f, good to firm; raced freely) 19 days ago
runners.spotlight: 80-1 and didn't show much when last of seven on debut at Leicester (7f, good to firm; raced freely) 19 days ago.

runners.name: Wild Embers
runners.comment: Third on debut but beaten 15l on stable debut at Wolverhampton; up to 7.5f for turf debut
runners.spotlight: Third of 12 on debut at Dundalk (5f, AW) when trained by Daniel McLoughlin but beaten 15l when fourth of eight on stable debut at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) in March; steps up to 7.5f for turf debut; better is needed.

runners.name: Lady Of The Isles
runners.comment: Showed more at Windsor last time but she may be the type to do better in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Showed more at Windsor (1m, good to firm) 31 days ago than she did at Kempton (1m, AW) in December but she may be the type for handicaps after this.

runners.name: Polygram
runners.comment: Pulled clear of the third with a promising filly at Newcastle last time; strong claims
runners.spotlight: Sixth of seven on her sole start for Sir Michael Stoute but she caught the eye when fourth behind subsequent Listed winner Kon Tiki on yard debut at Kempton (1m, AW) and pulled clear of the third with a promising rival at Newcastle (1m, AW) last time; returns to grass with strong claims.

quotes.race: Roflow Memorial Race Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a nice run. There wasn't much pace on and it was a bit tactical but the first two are two nice fillies who have had a good battle to the line. Polygram was still a little bit green under pressure but she'll take another step forward and she'll probably be seen to better effect when she gets on the grass - Callum Rodriguez, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

4:30.going_detailed: POLYTRACK: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Ancient State
runners.comment: Won off 5lb lower at Wolverhampton; fourth here (6f) since; turf debut; can go well.
runners.spotlight: Justified market support in first-time tongue-tie off 5lb lower at Wolverhampton (5f) in March before finishing fourth of ten here (6f, AW) 49 days ago, despite racing freely; makes turf debut and likely to go well if coping with the grass.

runners.name: Rogue Endeavour
runners.comment: 0-10; posted a solid effort on stable debut over 6f at Salisbury 14 days ago; respected.
runners.spotlight: 0-10; solid effort when fourth of 11 on recent stable debut at Salisbury (6f, good to firm) on his first start for 90 days; has dropped a long way in the weights and he's respected; stablemate of Oldbury Lad.

runners.name: Atherstone Beau
runners.comment: 0-8 but not beaten far off 9lb higher on AW in January; yard debut; cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but he wasn't beaten far at Newcastle (5f, AW) in January off 9lb higher; shaped as if she would benefit from a return to this trip when fourth at Newcastle on her final start for Roger Fell in March; makes her stable debut returned to turf in the added cheekpieces.

runners.name: All Too Beautiful
runners.comment: Has shown ability in three starts and she may have more to come now handicapping.
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in two 6f starts last year but she raced too freely on comeback at Bath (6f, good to firm) last month; she's well related, half-sister to winners including Got To Love A Grey (Listed at about 5f) and there may be more to come now handicapping.

runners.name: Castellina
runners.owner: Hot To Trot Racing 2 And The Hoppers
runners.comment: Shaped with promise on handicap debut at Chelmsford in the added tongue-tie; respected
runners.spotlight: Has a nice pedigree; she ran to just a modest level in three starts last year but there was promise in her sixth of nine on handicap debut at Chelmsford (6f, AW; first-time tongue tie) following a slow start; may benefit from that first outing for 174 days and she's respected.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely filly out of Firenze and James Fanshawe likes what he's seen of her so far. He's never in a rush with horses and she's likely to come out in August or September. 02-08-24

runners.name: Surprise Again
runners.comment: Struggled in three starts; drop to 6f needs to make a difference on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Struggled on his sole start for Richard Fahey and two outings over 1m for this yard; out of a 6f winner so the drop down in distance might help but it does need to now back on turf for handicap debut.

runners.name: Time After Time
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D R Guest & Mr & Mrs Jpm Main
runners.comment: Shown little in three starts and now drops in trip for turf/handicap debut; watch market
runners.spotlight: Shown little in three outings on AW (8.5f/7f) but she's a half-sister to connections' multiple 7f AW winner Ash Wednesday and may yet do better; watch the market on turf/handicap debut now dropping in trip.

runners.name: Top Biller
runners.comment: Hasn't progressed since winning in first-time blinkers but did run respectably last time.
runners.spotlight: Won in first-time blinkers at Wolverhampton (6f) in January when trained by Jamie Osborne; hasn't progressed since but he ran respectably at Chelmsford (6f, AW) 35 days ago; place claims.

runners.name: Bluesy Moon
runners.comment: 0-11; has been placed over 5.5f on her last two outings and can go well again.
runners.spotlight: Yet to win in 11 starts but she's been placed over 5.5f at Brighton and Bath on her last two starts; place claims.

runners.name: Lady Shinto
runners.comment: Well held on handicap debut at Chelmsford over 7f; back to 6f in the hood with more needed
runners.spotlight: Showed modest ability in three 6f novice/maiden events and she was well held when fifth of eight on handicap debut at Chelmsford (7f, AW; hung right); drops back in distance with the hood applied on the return to turf; more needed.

runners.name: Oldbury Lad
runners.comment: Showed more in first-time cheekpieces over 6f at Salisbury last time; holds claims.
runners.spotlight: Showed more than he had previously when fifth of 11 in first-time cheekpieces at Salisbury (6f, good to firm) 14 days ago; claims if he's able to build on that; stablemate of Rogue Endeavour.

runners.name: Runnindown A Dream
runners.comment: Down the field in five starts (5f-1m); best to look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Down the field in five starts (5f-1m) when sent off big prices each time; best to look elsewhere.

5:05.race_name: Tips For Every Race At raceday-ready.com Handicap
5:05.going_detailed: POLYTRACK: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Over Spiced
runners.comment: 3lb wrong under penalty for her 5f Chepstow win but holds strong claims nonetheless.
runners.spotlight: Built on the encouragement of her Windsor effort to double her tally at Chepstow (5f, good) eight days ago; had the benefit of the stands' side rail that day and she's 3lb wrong under her penalty, but holds strong claims nonetheless.

runners.name: Step Along
runners.comment: Best handicap form when third behind Over Spiced last time; 6lb better off this time
runners.spotlight: Best handicap form so far when third behind Over Spiced at Chepstow (5f, good) eight days ago and now meets that rival on 6lb better terms; unexposed and may be able to reverse those placings.

runners.name: Watkins
runners.comment: 0-12; yet to build on last month's runner-up effort on AW; but drops in grade.
runners.spotlight: 0-12; finished runner-up on AW here last month; he's failed to build on that in two turf starts since but back down in grade and has claims in a weak race.

runners.name: Dreambird Dolly
runners.owner: T Beeches, C Stone, J Gallagher
runners.comment: Beaten a neck at Brighton last month but ran poorly at Nottingham last time.
runners.spotlight: 0-7 but she was only beaten a neck at Brighton (5.5f, good to firm) last month; needs to bounce back from a subsequent poor effort at Nottingham (5f, good to firm) though.

runners.name: Sassy Sprezzatura
runners.comment: Shown little in three starts; now drops to 5f on handicap debut with a tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: Showed little in two starts last year and beat only one rival home on her return at Lingfield (6f, AW) in March; now drops to 5f with the tonuge-tie on for handicap/turf debut; watch the betting.

3:30.race_name: Luncheon Voucher Club Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Izakaya
runners.comment: Struggled to get competitive when a big-priced outsider for first two Flat starts
runners.spotlight: Struggled to get competitive when a big-priced outsider for first two Flat starts (both 1m4f); similar outcome very likely today.

runners.name: Maritime Mist
runners.comment: Tailed off in a bumper last summer; makes Flat/stable debut here
runners.spotlight: Out of a 5f winner from a good sprinting family; tailed off in good-ground Uttoxeter bumper for Barry Brennan last summer; can only be watched on this Flat/stable debut.

runners.name: Cloaks Of Gold
runners.comment: Made a lot of the running before fading into third on recent Salisbury debut; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Out of close relative of top-class miler/sire Dubawi; made a lot of the running before fading into very respectable third of six on recent Salisbury debut (1m2f, good to firm); contender if able to build on it.

runners.name: El Budoor
runners.comment: Showed her inexperience when seventh at Ascot three weeks ago; likely improver here
runners.spotlight: First foal from a multiple Group 2 winner at up to 2m; started slowly and showed her inexperience when seventh of ten at Ascot (1m2f, good to firm) three weeks ago but significant positives can still be drawn from that performance and she ought to be more streetwise here; must be considered.

runners.name: Glint Of Light
runners.comment: Out of a well-connected 1m-1m2f mare; has fairly good standard to reach on debut
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-sister to winners Sunset Bay (7f; RPR 97) and Loving Look (1m2f turf/1m4f AW; 87); dam placed 1m-1m2f (63), closely related to 6f Group 3 winner Bygone Days, half-sister to smart 5f-7f winner Dungannon; worth a glance in the betting but has fairly good standard to reach.

runners.name: Kathleen Mary
runners.comment: Showed promise on slow ground in the autumn but needs improvement here
runners.spotlight: Displayed promise on slow ground in the autumn, latterly when fourth of 12 at Newmarket (7f, soft); needs improvement here but this new trip and surface combination could plausibly show her in a better light.

runners.name: Knickerbocker
runners.comment: Chased home subsequent Musidora third Go Go Boots over C&D last month; a possible
runners.spotlight: Made low-key debut in the autumn but fared much better when clear second (albeit no match for winner) behind subsequent Musidora third Go Go Boots over C&D last month, and further progress is possible.

runners.name: Miss Herschel
runners.comment: Made very promising debut when keeping-on third over 1m here in December; good chance
runners.spotlight: Closely related to very useful 1m 2yo winner Mister Mister; dam well-connected German 1m2f winner; made very promising debut when keeping-on third behind recent Musidora third Go Go Boots here (1m) in December and should have a lot more to offer this year.

runners.name: Model Yuko
runners.comment: Made just a mildly encouraging debut last month; creditable 3rd at Leicester on Tuesday
runners.spotlight: Ouf of a half-sister to Yorkshire Oaks winner Quiff; made just a mildly encouraging debut when never-dangerous fourth at Wolverhampton (8.6f) but she kept on well when third at Leicester (1m, good) on Tuesday and is open to improvement over 1m2f.

runners.name: Queen Himiko
runners.comment: Placed on last three of her five 2yo starts; others in this field have more potential
runners.spotlight: Placed on the latest three of her five starts, most recently when third of 12 in Class 5 Wolverhampton nursery (8.6f, AW) in December, but others in this line-up probably have more potential.

runners.name: Safe And Sound
runners.comment: Has very good pedigree but did not get competitive after racing too freely on debut
runners.spotlight: Golden Horn filly from very good family that includes Gold Cup hero Courage Mon Ami and 1m4f AW Listed winner Lion's Pride; 11-8 favourite for recent debut at Kempton (7f; hooded, as today), where she raced too freely in rear and never got competitive; ought to be suited by today's longer trip but evidently has a lot to learn.

runners.name: Silver Chamber
runners.comment: Last month's reappearance run was underwhelming but her autumn debut was promising
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to Listed Flat/smart hurdle winner Absurde, out of Listed-placed 1m2f winner; rather disappointing when only seventh of ten on last month's seasonal reappearance at Haydock (1m, good) but her debut at Newmarket (7f, good to soft) in the autumn was promising and today's step up in trip ought to suit.

runners.name: Treasured Angel
runners.breeder: Kirtlington Park, A Davis & E Foster
runners.comment: Kept on steadily for fourth on Newmarket debut; can improve but needs to
runners.spotlight: Sluggish in early stages before keeping on steadily for never-dangerous fourth on debut at Newmarket (1m, good to soft) in April; open to improvement but others have more pressing claims all the same.

runners.name: Witch Hazel
runners.comment: Made fairly encouraging debut over C&D but her second run was a backward step
runners.spotlight: Has a good pedigree but failed to build upon last month's fairly encouraging C&D debut when well-held sixth at Kempton (1m4f) a fortnight ago; others look much stronger.

3:00.race_name: Twelfth Barry Gurr Memorial Claiming Stakes

runners.name: Born Ruler
runners.comment: Ran well in two good-quality turf handicaps this month; ought to be hard to beat here
runners.spotlight: Back from layoff with two creditable runs in good-quality turf handicaps this month, more recently when fourth in Zetland Gold Cup at Redcar (1m2f, good to firm) on Monday; also suited by Polytrack and ought to be hard to beat in this much easier race; cheekpieces refitted.

runners.name: Encourager
runners.breeder: Ghs Bloodstock Ltd & Mrs Ann Foley
runners.comment: 7f novice winner in October 2023 but not seen again since
runners.spotlight: Looked very promising when narrow winner of 7f Kempton maiden in October 2023, on second start, but he hasn't been seen again since and it's not encouraging to see him reappear in plating company.

runners.name: Prometeo
runners.comment: Below form this month but last year's form (four wins) gives him strong claims
runners.spotlight: Has something to prove after below-par reappearance run two weeks ago but collected four wins (1m2f-1m3f; turf/AW) during productive campaign last year and has strong claims at this level if judged on those exploits.

runners.name: Galileos Compass
runners.comment: Ten-race maiden who has struggled in two 1m4f Brighton handicaps for new stable this year
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden who has struggled in two 1m4f Brighton handicaps for new stable this spring; has too much to prove.

stable_tour.quote: A full-brother to Changingoftheguard. His work is very nice and he makes his debut in a 1m5f maiden at Navan on Saturday. 21-04-23

runners.name: Invincible Navy
runners.comment: Safely held off lowly marks in three Brighton handicaps this spring; up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Safely held off lowly marks in three Brighton handicaps this spring (7f/1m) and now 0-16 overall; tries a new trip here.

runners.name: Rogue Soldier
runners.comment: 1m handicap winner here last summer but both runs for new yard this spring were poor
runners.spotlight: Signed off for James Owen with 1m Class 5 handicap win here last summer and he should be fine over today's trip but both 7f runs for new stable this year have been very disappointing.

runners.name: Tango Sunset
runners.breeder: Klaus & B Goersch & C & S Ransom
runners.owner: Mrs Brigitte Goersch & Joe Bear Racing
runners.comment: Best effort came over this trip in November when last seen; respected on her return
runners.spotlight: 0-6; posted her best effort when upped to 2m at Wolverhampton (AW; raced freely) in November when she made a move to lead before weakening to finish third; off since but she's respected in this lower grade on her return.

runners.name: Onesteptwosteps
runners.comment: 0-11 overall; pulled up over fences in December when last seen; best watched after a break
runners.spotlight: 0-11 (Flat/jumps); made most when fifth of ten at Kempton (1m4f, AW) last August but pulled up when reported to have made a respiratory noise over fences at Lingfield (2m, soft) in December; best watched on return from 171 days off.

runners.name: Sydney Seabreeze
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Hoguenet Et Al
runners.comment: 0-9 but he wasn't beaten far in fourth over C&D off 6lb higher in September; holds claims.
runners.spotlight: 0-9; second at Wolverhampton (1m6f) on return but below-form favourite there last time; fourth over C&D in September off 6lb higher, so he holds claims on his return to this track and with step back up in trip.

runners.name: Blenheim Lad
runners.comment: Both wins been over 1m6f at Southwell; needs to leave his reappearance effort well behind
runners.spotlight: Both wins were over 1m6f on Southwell AW last autumn, the latest off 4lb lower than today; disappointing on final start last year and well beaten at Kempton (2m, AW; 50-1) on his return; needs to take a big step forward from that and he is back down in grade.

runners.name: Balgowan
runners.comment: Got off the mark at Southwell last time following a string of good efforts; claims up 2lb.
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at the 22nd attempt, at Southwell (2m, AW; drifted left once hitting the front) 57 days ago; consistent profile since joining this stable and likely to go well again following a 2lb rise.

runners.name: Queensland Boy
runners.comment: Escapes a penalty for his comfortable Wolverhampton win and looks a leading contender.
runners.spotlight: Returned to form under Ryan Kavanagh at Wolverhampton (2m, AW) ten days ago following 89 days off, kicking clear on the home turn before eased down late on; escapes a penalty for that success (due to be 8lb higher) and he's a leading contender.

runners.name: Kevano Breeze
runners.comment: Well beaten in three novice/maiden events (1m3f/1m); up in trip for his handicap debut
runners.spotlight: 0-6 (Flat/bumpers) but he did show ability when fourth of seven in a C&D bumper in December (hung left); well beaten in three Flat novice/maiden events (1m3f/1m) but he should be suited by the step up in trip on handicap debut.

runners.name: Smith
runners.comment: Seven-time C&D who was runner-up here off this mark last time; sound claims once again
runners.spotlight: A seven-time C&D winner whose most recent success came in December off 3lb lower; pulled up over hurdles in April but bounced back to be runner-up back over C&D; sound claims at his favoured track.

runners.name: Blonde Arrow
runners.comment: Offered little in four starts; others preferred on her first start since November.
runners.spotlight: Has offered little in four starts, including on handicap debut at Southwell (2m, AW; first-time hood) in November when last seen; hood removed for this reappearance; others preferred.

3:50.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (Watered)
3:50.stalls: Straight - Stands side; Round - Inside; 1m4f - Centre

runners.name: Touch The Moon
runners.comment: Solid return to Britain when third over 1m4f here last month; respected in new cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Successful twice in Bahrain over the winter and made a solid return to Britain when third over 1m4f here 33 days ago, leading until over 1f out; raced only on good/good to firm on turf; respected off an unchanged mark in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Have Secret

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mary, Lady Manton

runners.comment: Right back in form this spring, winning over C&D before third at York; should figure again
runners.spotlight: Threatened last season to break his losing run and it finally happened over C&D (good) last month; went back up 8lb for that clearcut success but showed he can still be very competitive when third of 13 to Thunder Run at the recent York Dante meeting (1m2f, good to firm); would have no issues were the ground to ease; likely to be in thick of things again.

quotes.race: Coral Kincsem Handicap
quotes.quote: Have Secret has run a cracking race, which he has done all season. He's a horse who is getting better with racing, but he keeps just finding one or two. But we are delighted with him - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Have Secret tends to race behind the bridle but keeps finding. The step up in trip helped him and he handled the ground. Oisin Orr, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Have Secret deserved that after he ran well at Chester last week on a course that didn't suit him. He was going to go up the ratings so we thought we'd come here and he's going to go up even further now. He'll make a nice 3yo next year - Robin O'Ryan, assistant to trainer Richard Fahey.

runners.name: Padishakh
runners.comment: Winning start for Ed Bethell over 1m at Nottingham and remains well treated on old form
runners.spotlight: Had ups and downs for David O'Meara but sent off a short-priced favourite and back to form to take advantage of reduced mark for new trainer at Nottingham (1m, good to firm) 19 days ago; remains with plenty of handicapping scope on peak form off 3lb higher; has done the majority of his racing at 1m but a never-nearer fifth over 1m2f at Meydan in January suggests he is effective at this trip; soft-ground winner in France so rain no problem.

quotes.race: Download The PricedUp App Handicap
quotes.quote: Padishakh has got great back form which suggested he was very well in here. He's been set some fairly tough asks but is one for major handicaps as the faster they go the better it suits him - Ed Bethell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Had his first start for us in the Doncaster Mile when he didn't appreciate the heavy ground. He's got some good form in France and had a run in Britain at the end of last year for Roger Varian when he probably didn't handle Newmarket. From what we saw in France last year he possesses a good deal of ability and hopefully we can get him back on track. There's a lovely horse in there. 19-04-24

runners.name: Big Meeting
runners.comment: Useful in 2022 but not seen again until well held in early 2024 and off again   since
runners.spotlight: Useful 1m-1m2f form in Britain in 2022 but not seen again until well held in Dubai in February 2024 and absent again since.

runners.name: Arthurs Realm

prev_owners.owner: Paul Turner and King for a Day

runners.comment: Fair fifth in Spring Mile latest and won Zetland Gold Cup off 1lb higher last May; player
runners.spotlight: Suited by ground softer than good; added to his decent record in the Doncaster Spring Mile when fifth of 21 to Pearl Eye last time; now 1lb lower than when winning the 2024 Zetland Gold Cup at Redcar (1m2f, soft); big player under Tudhope, particularly if rain hits.

quotes.race: Racing TV Zetland Gold Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Arthur's Realm has appreciated the return to an easy surface and it's great that he's managed to win over a mile and a quarter - Ed Dunlop, trainer.

quotes.race: SBK Spring Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: The race fell lovely for me. Arthur's Realm travelled well and they went a nice gallop. Ed was a bit wary of the ground but as the racing has gone on they've got into it, it's a bit holding, and it suited him - Rossa Ryan, jockey

quotes.race: Follow @RiponRaces On Twitter Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Arthur's Realm was a little awkward in the paddock but he's quite talented. We ran him over a mile and a quarter and he probably didn't quite stay: we dropped him to a mile and he's gone and won for us - Robin Trevor-Jones, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's as old as you and me put together but ran very well again in the Spring Mile a few weeks ago, finishing fifth and not beaten far - it was a race he'd won in 2022. He won the Zetland Gold Cup last year very impressively and that race has been the aim again since Doncaster, but whether the ground will come right, I don't know. He needs slow ground. He still seems to have his old enthusiasm for the game and he's been a star. 30-04-25

runners.name: Lets Dream
runners.comment: Lwo-mileage 4yo who arrives on the back of a win at Chester May meeting; respected
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who added to his Goodwood maiden win (1m2f, soft) last autumn when landing a Chester handicap (10.3f, good) 20 days ago; that was a narrow success at 33-1 but he held off a clear second and a 4lb rise looks fair enough; another to consider.

quotes.race: Precision Facades Handicap (GBBPus Race)
quotes.quote: Warren [Fentiman] gave Let's Dream an absolute peach of a ride. I told him to get in the first two or three and just control the race. With a low weight, Warren's claim and his two-year-old form he was well handicapped. He rode it to perfection and we've gone back-to-back in this. It's a lovely race to get in the bag but there's no immediate targets - Michael Bell, trainer.

runners.name: First View
runners.comment: Held by the reopposing Padishakh on his recent return to Britain at Nottingham
runners.spotlight: Dubai regular who was only seventh of eight to the reopposing Padishakh at Nottingham on his recent return to Britain; will need to leave that behind in refitted cheekpieces.

runners.name: Yorkshire Lady
runners.owner: J Munroe, M Mchale & R Wreglesworth

prev_owners.owner: J Munroe, M McHale & K Wreglesworth
A Pollock, K Wreglesworth & J Munroe
L Folwell, K Wreglesworth & J Munroe

runners.comment: No impact over hurdles this winter and well held back on Flat here last month
runners.spotlight: In decent form on the Flat last autumn but no significant impact in two handicap hurdles this winter and well beaten back on the level here six weeks ago.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Kilkerran Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: That was brilliant. Yorkshire Lady is so hardy. Serena Brotherton rides her out every day and she's come on no end for her last run when she was fourth at York and ran a blinder. Everyone keeps saying she wants soft ground but she just goes better on it when others don't - Jo Mason, jockey.

runners.name: Financer
runners.owner: S Bulmer, P Hebdon & R Taylor
runners.comment: Chased home Have Secret on C&D reappearance and excuse at York since
runners.spotlight: Three 1m2f wins last year came on good/good to firm but he probably acts on soft; respectable second to Have Secret on C&D reappearance and caught too far back at York since; capable of bouncing back.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice colt by Cracksman who's had only one run, finishing fifth at York. We like him and you'd think he'll be a middle-distance horse. 23-04-24

runners.name: High Point
runners.comment: Seventh on AW both starts this year but a 3-6 turf record affords him respect; rain a help
runners.spotlight: All of his turf runs have been on good or slower; down the field in two AW starts for new yard this year but he's 0-4 in that sphere compared to a record of 3-6 on turf; all of those wins were in 1m2f handicaps and he needs watching in the market back in this sphere.

quotes.race: British EBF Ruby Anniversary Nursery Handicap (Sire And Dam Restricted Race)
quotes.quote: High Point ran a nice race at Windsor last time and we were quite confident coming in as he is a galloping type. He could get a mile and three quarters next year - George Downing, rider.

runners.name: Ey Up Its The Boss
runners.owner: Mrs M Lingwood And S Bland
runners.comment: Good Ripon record and 1m4f likely stretched him at York latest; has to enter calculations
runners.spotlight: Good record over C&D, including two wins on good ground last year; weakened when stepped up to 1m4f at York last time but the return to shorter is a plus and he's only 1lb higher than when edging out Monday's Zetland Gold Cup winner Liberty Coach at Redcar last autumn; has to enter calculations.

runners.name: Titian
runners.comment: Off for 160 days but can't be discounted having won this off 2lb higher last year
runners.spotlight: Peak fitness has to be taken trust after 160 days off but he can't be discounted having won this race off 2lb higher on soft ground last year.

quotes.race: Ripon Cathedral Handicap
quotes.quote: We'd pondered for a while about stepping back up to this trip as Titian has some decent form over a mile without winning recently. This year he's looked like he's really ready for the extra two furlongs and he seems to handle Ripon really well. He's adaptable and everything came together. It wasn't a big field but they were a select bunch. He was tough and showed a good attitude, which is pleasing. He takes a couple of weeks between races and I think we'll look at those decent midweek handicaps or the Sunday races because they have decent prize-money - Steve Brown, assistant to trainer Julie Camacho.

stable_tour.quote: A three-time winner who has some very good runs to his name this season. He won at York ten months ago but you could argue his run in the Spring Mile at Doncaster when second of 22 was a better effort. He put up another good effort when third in the Boodles Handicap at Newmarket's July meeting, while I was happy enough with his effort at Chepstow last month. He can get better in the autumn on proper soft ground over a mile. The target is the Straight Mile Championship at Redcar. 06-09-23

3:20.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (Watered)
3:20.stalls: Straight - Stands side; Round - Inside; 1m4f - Centre

runners.name: On Key
runners.comment: Best 2yo efforts on AW; gelded since last seen; improvement needed but quite possible
runners.spotlight: Placed in three of his five 2yo starts, the latest a close second in an AW nursery in December (6f); gelded since; likely he will need further improvement to score.

runners.name: Amor Cordis
runners.comment: Two solid handicap runs this year and he's one to take seriously on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Failed to win in six starts for his former stable but his two runs this year (gelded over the winter) have been promising, close up at Wolverhampton (7f) before a good fourth at Haydock last month (Vault Of Heaven fifth; strong form); starts out for a new trainer (same owner) with a good claimer taking off 5lb; can go well.

runners.name: Barmyblade
runners.comment: 3-4 this year, the last two over C&D this month; may not have reached his ceiling yet
runners.spotlight: Modest form in seven 2yo runs but he's been a different proposition this year, winning a Catterick handicap on his reappearance (5f, good) and adding two C&D wins this month; 1lb wrong under his 6lb penalty but he's a thriving sprinter who may not have reached his ceiling just yet.

runners.name: Tarlac
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: 0-8 but he's been threatening and latest Hamilton 2nd a career best; shouldn't be far away
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but he's shown winning potential and he went down narrowly at Hamilton 25 days ago (6f, good to firm); that effort is backed up by the Topspeed figure; shouldn't be far away.

runners.name: Rumba Bay
runners.comment: Three wins this year, the latest her turf breakthrough two weeks ago; high on the list
runners.spotlight: Three wins this year, the latest a breakthrough turf success at Salisbury two weeks ago (6f, good to firm); up 5lb but going the right way and she shouldn't be taken lightly.

runners.name: Triple Charged
runners.comment: Yet to find his best form for current stable; cheekpieces now tried; due to drop 3lb
runners.spotlight: A couple of promising efforts for Karl Burke on AW around the turn of the year; yet to fire in four starts for new stable and new cheekpieces need to give him a lift; due to be 3lb lower from the weekend.

runners.name: Vault Of Heaven
runners.comment: Just failed to land gamble on AW in November; reappearance 5th working out well; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who was beaten by just a nose (sent off favourite) on his nursery debut at Newcastle in November (6f); only fifth on his Haydock reappearance but that form is working out extremely well and he probably wasn't helped by racing furthest from the stands' rail; could do with settling better but he's one to consider.

runners.name: For What Its Worth
runners.comment: Potential improver now handicapping over a shorter trip; worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Out the back in three maiden/novice runs over further but the last two runs haven't been devoid of promise; faces a more realistic challenge now handicapping, even from 3lb wrong; stable on a seven-month losing run but he needs a market check.

2:20.race_name: Visit attheraces.com EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
2:20.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (Watered)
2:20.stalls: Straight - Stands side; Round - Inside; 1m4f - Centre

runners.name: Alex Supreme
runners.comment: 20,000euros half-sister to three winners; yard rich in 2yo talent; a newcomer of note
runners.spotlight: February foal; 20,000euros yearling; seventh foal; half-sister to winners Future King (7f AW; RPR 96), Alwajd (1m-1m2f AW; 71) and Ronzinante (Italian 1m/1m3f AW); dam 7f winner (including 2yo; 79); stable rich in 2yo talent and she's a newcomer of note.

runners.name: Baggot Street
runners.comment: Too green to do herself justice here (5f, good) on debut; bred to do much better
runners.spotlight: 14-1 and too green to do herself justice in a 5f maiden here three weeks ago but she showed some promise and could take a big step forward with the run behind her; bred to be smart and 6f should suit.

runners.name: Belling The Cat
runners.comment: Sister to 6f 2yo winner Hougomont (RPR 78); useful standard to aim at; yard run two
runners.spotlight: April foal; fifth foal; sister to 6f 2yo winner Hougoumont (RPR 78); dam 5f winner (including 2yo; 84); she'll need to be above average to make a winning debut; stable also run Peggy Boo.

runners.name: Peggy Boo
runners.owner: S Ullyott, T Coyle & P Robinson
runners.comment: Debut effort not without hope but significant progress is a must
runners.spotlight: 16-1 into 12-1 on last month's Redcar debut (5f, good), a race in which she dropped away in the final furlong and was over 5l back in fifth; can do better but such progress is a must.

runners.name: Preminision
runners.comment: Half-sister to 2 winners; stable's 2yos more forward this year than usual; check betting
runners.spotlight: May foal; fourth foal; half-sister to winners Majin Bu (Italian Listed-placed 1m AW including 2yo; RPR 92) and Thankuappreciate (5f/6f including 2yo; 86); dam 1m 2yo winner (74); stable have had a winning 2yo newcomer this season and she's worth a market check.

runners.name: Solana Rose
runners.comment: Shaped with considerable promise in a York Listed race on debut; sets a good standard
runners.spotlight: Thrown in at the deep end when making her debut in the Listed Marygate Stakes at York two weeks ago (5f, good to firm) and she ran a pleasing race to finish sixth, beaten less than 4l despite evident inexperience and some traffic issues; leading claims with that experience behind her in these calmer waters.

runners.name: Star Of Life
runners.comment: First foal of a maiden from a good family; yard have had a winning 2yo debutante this year
runners.spotlight: February foal; first foal of maiden from a good family; signs that the stable's hot streak is cooling in the last fortnight but she's still a newcomer of note.

4:20.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (Watered)
4:20.stalls: Straight - Stands side; Round - Inside; 1m4f - Centre

runners.name: Tickets
runners.comment: Better on AW but handicapped accordingly and won well at Redcar last month
runners.spotlight: Made it three wins from his last ten runs when exploiting his lower turf mark at Redcar (6f, good to firm) last month, beating the reopposing Variety Island; still looks feasibly treated up 4lb; significant rain might compromise him.

stable_tour.quote: He is a lovely young horse who runs in the well-known green colours of John Fretwell. He has only raced four times in his life, winning his penultimate start at Kempton. I thought his most recent run, when second in his first handicap was a lovely effort and hopefully we can get him out on the turf before the season ends, but he needs it on the soft side. He will continue through the winter on the all-weather as he is still progressing, and we can up him to 1m when the time is right. He is on a fair mark of 77 and I would be disappointed if he was not a nice bit better than that. 29-08-22

runners.name: Canaria Queen
runners.comment: Not at best here 11 days ago but rain won't hurt and she's fully effective at 6f
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come on slower than good; not at her best over 5f here 11 days ago but her earlier close third at Catterick was a solid run; Duran Fentiman replaces a 7lb claimer; chance.

runners.name: Eldeyaar
runners.comment: Two C&D wins to his name and 5lb lower than for the latest; not at best so far this year
runners.spotlight: Two of his three turf wins have come over C&D, the latest off 5lb higher last September (soft ground); not in top form when last seen in February.

runners.name: Bellagio Man
runners.comment: 2023 turf form gives him a squeak off his lowly mark; risky but could go well
runners.spotlight: Several good AW runs this year and he is rated 9lb lower on turf than AW; rain won't bother him and although there are risks involved, a prominent showing would be no surprise; visor the headgear of choice today.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden (Plus 10 Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It was a good performance and Bellagio Man had to be brave. He had a terrible draw but it helped that the favourite got stuck in the stalls. Fair play to Colin and the horse as they took advantage of that. He's still a green horse and will improve from it. He was in front a long way from home and it was a fair performance. He wouldn't ideally like that ground, it went a bit slow, and we were a bit nervous before the race with the heavy showers yesterday and today. He's a good ground horse but because it was the first race we said we'd take our chance and we got away with it - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Enderman
runners.comment: Third in this race in 2022 on his only other Ripon run; dangerous mark and rain no problem
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner but he was third in this race in 2022 on his only other Ripon appearance; not found his best form in two runs this spring but he's on a dangerous mark and a change of headgear could help (has won in visor).

stable_tour.quote: He has finished second in eaof his last four races. You feel so sorry for him because nine times out of ten he puts a shift in and always runs his race, but he's been finding one too good. He's fairly straightforward but lacks that fifth gear, so he's always vulnerable. But he'll win again when things go right for him. He's always picking up prize-money, so you can't really knock him or condemn him. 28-06-24

runners.name: Ishe Worth Agamble
runners.comment: 6f win at Leicester on return; similar form under penalty latest; rain perhaps not ideal
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to win a 6f handicap at Leicester (good to firm) on his seasonal return 19 days ago; respectable third under a penalty six days later; further progress required to take this and his best form has come on good to firm.

runners.name: Hurstwood
runners.owner: Hard Held Partnership And Angus Racing
runners.comment: 1st and 2nd in the last two runnings; good second at Thirsk 12 days ago; solid candidate
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner, including this race in 2023 (also finished second in it in 2024); ran well on his recent return to turf, finishing a close second of 13 at Thirsk (6f, good to firm); rain won't be an issue and he's a solid candidate.

quotes.race: Brittains Beverages British EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Hurstwood is very hardy and genuine. On his next run we're going to step him up to six furlongs and see how he gets on - David Armstrong, owner.

runners.name: Elliott
runners.comment: Disappointing favourite on his return to Britain; change of headgear today; risky
runners.spotlight: 5f AW winner in his first stint with Rebecca Menzies; sent off favourite for his return to this yard (trained in Ireland in 2024) last month but over-raced early and was never in contention; something to prove after that and a new visor replaces cheekpieces.

runners.name: Variety Island
runners.owner: Grange Park Racing Xvi And Partners
runners.comment: Two good runs this year and rain won't bother him; yet to shine at Ripon though
runners.spotlight: Not at his best in two visits to Ripon, including when sixth in the corresponding race 12 months ago; comes here on the back of two good fast-ground runs this year and rain won't faze him.

runners.name: Juryman
runners.comment: Not beaten far at Thirsk (behind Hurstwood) 12 days ago; rain would aid his cause
runners.spotlight: Ran well at Thirsk 12 days ago, finishing close up in fourth (6f, good to firm; Hurstwood second); new cheekpieces can help and he's one to consider, especially with rain in his favour.

runners.name: Better

prev_owners.owner: D Mann, Mrs C Hopper & G Shields

runners.comment: Lower rating on turf but with some justification; laboured sixth at Thirsk 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: His best form has come on AW but rated lower in this sphere and he wasn't beaten far into sixth in a slightly higher grade at Thirsk 12 days ago (6f, good to firm); made fairly heavy weather of it though and others appeal more for win purposes.

runners.name: Missmimi
runners.comment: AW win last September (6f); has run well over C&D; yard in fine form; considered
runners.spotlight: 13th-time lucky when winning a Newcastle handicap (6f) last September; good C&D run last summer; has an absence to overcome but yard have their small string in rude health.

runners.name: Fumbleinthejungle
runners.comment: Finished last in both runs back from mammoth absence; new cheekpieces not enough to tempt
runners.spotlight: Yet to beat a rival in two runs back from a mammoth absence (both 5f on good to firm); new cheekpieces not enough to tempt.

runners.name: Golden Prosperity
runners.comment: Yet to win at 6f and not hit top form so far this year; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Both his wins have come over 5f but he has placed form over C&D; needs to step up on this season's efforts to win.

runners.name: Miss Rainbow
runners.comment: Exposed maiden but her reappearance wasn't without hope; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: 0-19 and thoroughly exposed but she showed up well for long way on reappearance at Redcar (6f, good to firm) last month; each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: She wants bottomless ground but hasn't really had it since her first run last year at Catterick, where she was third. She's going really well at home and I'm just keeping her ticking over. She was entered at Thirsk last Saturday but the ground wasn't right for her. 21-05-25

2:50.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (Watered)
2:50.stalls: Straight - Stands side; Round - Inside; 1m4f - Centre

runners.name: Elizabeths Legacy
runners.owner: J Munroe, D Walshe & M Mchale

prev_owners.owner: M McHale, J Munroe, D Walshe

runners.comment: Well held both handicaps and others are more obvious
runners.spotlight: Well-held sixth in both handicaps, latterly Beverley reappearance 16 days ago; still early days but hard to make a good case for.

runners.name: Amber Honey
runners.comment: Comfortable win at Wolverhampton last week and the one to beat under penalty
runners.spotlight: Hinted at promise on a couple of occasions and it all clicked with a comfortable success at Wolverhampton (8.6f) last Thursday; the widest stall isn't ideal but she's still the one to beat under a penalty.

runners.name: Eye On The Prize
runners.comment: Well-held third over 7f at Catterick last weekend and others more persuasive
runners.spotlight: Failed to build on her C&D reappearance fifth when beaten just under 9l into third at Catterick (7f, good) on Saturday; the return to 1m may help but others are still preferred.

runners.name: Morning Angel
runners.comment: Only minor promise so far but low-grade handicaps provide her with a more realistic chance
runners.spotlight: Poor form in her three outings but low-grade handicaps provide her with a more realistic chance of success.

runners.name: Precious Spartan
runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: 0-11 for Nigel Tinker; has changed yard since well held at Doncaster 26 days ago
runners.spotlight: 0-11 for Nigel Tinkler, failing to build on close third at Redcar (1m2f, good) when down the field at Doncaster 26 days ago; first run for Patrick Neville.

runners.name: Lambournghini
runners.comment: Well held all three runs but worth a betting check now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Well held in three qualifying runs over 7f on AW and turf in recent months but worth a betting check now handicapping off a basement mark.

runners.name: Martha Costello
runners.owner: Mrs D Dalby & Harrowgate Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Third over 1m at Redcar latest but reopposing Mission To Malton was ahead in second
runners.spotlight: Reached the frame for the second time in handicaps when third over 1m at Redcar (good to firm) four weeks ago, although the reopposing Mission To Malton was ahead in second.

runners.name: Heartened
runners.comment: Big prices and yet to make a significant impact in her four handicaps
runners.spotlight: Big prices and yet to make a significant impact in her four handicaps; needs improvement.

runners.name: Aoifes Thunder
runners.comment: Well held all three runs for another yard but handicaps provide more realistic chance
runners.spotlight: Well held in AW maiden/novice events over shorter trips for the Dr Richard Newland and Jamie Insole stable but worth a precautionary betting check now handicapping for new trainer Warren Greatrex

runners.name: Mission In Malton
runners.comment: Second at Redcar in first-time cheekpieces; only eighth since but blinkers may spark him
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form in first-time cheekpieces when second (Martha Costello third) at Redcar (1m, good to firm) at the beginning of the month; didn't find the cheekpieces working as well a second time when only eighth at Carlisle ten days ago but capable of going well if reacting positively to the new headgear (blinkers).

4:55.race_name: Ripon Races Ladies Day 19th June Handicap
4:55.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (Watered)
4:55.stalls: Straight - Stands side; Round - Inside; 1m4f - Centre

runners.name: Free Speech
runners.comment: Below best on AW this year but could bounce back with a bold show if slow ground prevails
runners.spotlight: Not at the top of her game on either run this season (1m2f, AW) but she won two in a row in the second half of last year (1m4f/11.6f, soft/good to soft) and could bounce back with a bold show if slow ground prevails.

stable_tour.quote: She's done well, winning twice for us last year. She wants give in the ground. She needed the run very badly at Chelmsford first time out.
