There's a four-year-olds and upwards fillies' handicap coming up at Kempton on May 5 and, if we continue to have a dry spell, that's where she'll run next. She's in good form and has improved from three to four. 30-04-25

runners.name: Something
runners.comment: On a handy mark on his AW form from the end of last year and could have a part to play
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at Newcastle (1m4f, AW) this month when back from a break and best form has come on AW; however, he may have needed that recent run and there have been hints of promise on grass; on a handy mark on his AW form from the end of last year and could have a part to play.

runners.name: Ancient Myth
runners.comment: Remains lightly raced but has been unable to recapture the promise of his debut second
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who is one to watch in the betting on his third stable start; promising second on debut last February (9.4f, AW) but unable to recapture that promise since and needs to raise his game.

runners.name: Valley Of Flowers
runners.comment: Further is preferable and she lacks a recent run, but she ran well first time up last year
runners.spotlight: A longer trip would be preferable and she lacks a recent run, but she was runner-up three times last season (all at 2m), including on her reappearance, and could give a good account on this return to action.

runners.name: Clansman
runners.owner: Mrs C M Clarke, Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.comment: His form has been mixed across his six runs since last September but rain would be a plus
runners.spotlight: Two easy wins on heavy ground last April and well handicapped on that form; his form has been mixed across his six starts since last September but rain would be a plus and he's not ruled out.

runners.name: Curran
runners.owner: Mrs S Russell & A M Russell
runners.comment: Took step back in the right direction last month and this longer trip is worth another go
runners.spotlight: His form has gone the wrong way and he's yet to prove he wants this far, but last month's 8l third of ten at Ayr (1m2f, good) was a step back in the right direction and he shaped as though this trip would be worth another go.

runners.name: Tokyo Bay
runners.comment: Won heavy-ground C&D maiden last April but unable to kick on since
runners.spotlight: Won heavy-ground C&D maiden last April on third start and he's dropped down the weights; however, he's failed to kick on since that win and has failed to threaten on either outing this spring.

runners.name: Masekela
runners.comment: Ages since he won but promising signs of late and he's one to consider
runners.spotlight: It's ages since he won and he's nothing like the force of old but he's on a reduced mark and went close at Hamilton two starts ago; with a clear run he'd have been closer than a 5l seventh of 14 in a higher grade at York last time and he's one to consider.

quotes.race: Denford Stakes (Listed Race) (formerly The Washington Singer Stakes)
quotes.quote: Masekela has a couple of entries in the Champagne Stakes and the Royal Lodge and I need to talk to Andrew, but my view is that a mile is the right distance. William said he's a nice horse and there would be more to come. He said he'd make a nice 3yo, which we always felt as he's a big horse - Mick Mariscotti, owner.

stable_tour.quote: He won't run until later in the season, I gave him a good break when I got him from the sales last autumn. He'll be out from midsummer and I'm looking forward to him, we like him a lot. We bought him to run him at the big meetings and we gave him the winter off as he needed a break. He looks well handicapped and a mile and a half seems to be his trip. 23-04-24

runners.name: Freedom Day
runners.comment: Something to prove regarding current form but well treated and is back up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Something to prove regarding current form but he's tackled 7f/1m1f the last twice and is now 7lb lower than when a creditable fourth over 1m4f at Southwell (AW) last August; not written off now back up in trip.

runners.name: Warrior Lion
runners.comment: 0-21 but one to keep a close eye on in the betting on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Patchy Flat form this year and made it 0-21 under both codes when tailed off over hurdles at Down Royal in March; sold out of Anthony McCann's yard for £2,500 later that month; however, he's on a handy mark if a change of scenery has given him a boost; one to keep a close eye on in the betting.

5:30.race_name: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap
5:30.going_detailed: GOOD, good to soft in places (Watered)
5:30.stalls: Straight - Stands side; Round - Inside; 1m4f - Centre

runners.name: Havana Prince
runners.comment: Redcar winner last month; also a dual C&D scorer and should remain competitive up 4lb
runners.spotlight: Latest performance took his Redcar record to 2-2; also has form figures of 114 over this C&D and should remain very competitive off 4lb higher.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV In Stunning HD Handicap
quotes.quote: Havana Prince is a grand little horse. He may not be the classiest, but he makes up for that by being tough and genuine. That was as quick ground as he wants and you won't be seeing him again until there's a bit of rain. He loves Redcar and Ripon, so we'll wait for the rain and won't have to go out of Yorkshire to find more winning opportunities - Tony Coyle, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Amy Washbourne Bloom Digitally Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I would have been unlucky as I got hampered out of the gate and Havana Prince had to work hard to get into a good position. I thought we got racing plenty early and I needed the line in the last fifty yards - David Nolan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Cosmos Raj
runners.comment: Clear of rest when second over 1m2f here recently and the one to beat off same mark
runners.spotlight: Reliable sort who resumed winning ways in 1m Hamilton handicap (good to firm; has also won on good to soft) at the start of the month; came 4l clear of the rest when narrowly denied on follow up bid here (1m2f, good) 11 days ago and he's the one to beat off the same mark.

runners.name: Clear Angel
runners.breeder: Framont Ltd, R S Cockerill & Monceaux
runners.comment: Three 1m turf wins; fit from AW and can figure off his reduced mark
runners.spotlight: Has three 1m turf wins on good/good to soft, the latest off 6lb higher, although it was nearly two years ago; his two AW efforts this spring have been respectable and he could have a part to play from his reduced mark now back on the grass.

runners.name: Mariner

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Marriott
Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: 1mf course win this month; failed to stay 1m4f latest and likely still in form
runners.spotlight: Took 17 runs before finally getting off the mark but made it three wins in five starts when seeing off five rivals over 1m2f here (good) three weeks ago; didn't see things out over 1m4f at Doncaster since and treated as if still in form.

stable_tour.quote: He had his first run for us over hurdles at Musselburgh last week and did okay, finishing fourth. He'll go back on the Flat now and is probably very well handicapped. He's the type who'll be winning at the back end of January in a 0-65 over a mile at Wolverhampton. 05-12-24

runners.name: Volenti
runners.comment: Four AW wins since last autumn but well held back on turf here latest
runners.spotlight: Four wins on Newcastle AW since last autumn but well beaten back on turf here last month.

runners.name: Harswell Duke
runners.comment: Second on AW reappearance; all four wins on soft/heavy so rain a boost for him
runners.spotlight: Having only his third start for Liam Bailey when a creditable second on 1m Southwell reappearance four weeks ago; same mark back on turf; all four wins on soft/heavy so significant rain would boost his chance.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Spring Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: Everything was perfect for Harswell Duke today. The soft ground is what he needs - Roger Fell, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Places Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Harswell Duke is a tough horse and we've waited all year for this soft ground. We've always thought a lot of him and we had a few quid on him; he was 6-1 last night. He's declared for Nottingham on Wednesday but we'll probably give him a break and go for the Spring Mile next year - Mike Kirby, part of Harswell Thoroughbred Racing, owners.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Harswell Duke found plenty and had been crying out for this softer ground. He was gutsy there to fend off the second.- Jason Hart, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Spring Mile for us last year. He's run really well when things have fallen into place for him - he needs soft or heavy ground and a good pace to aim at on a stiff track. He was only just beaten at Pontefract in April and then six days later he was just touched off again at Wetherby. He's dying to land one soon, it's just getting the ground right for him. He's never let us down on testing ground, so he could have a run at Haydock soon. His main target would be a mile handicap at Nottingham on October 2 - you'd hope he'll get his conditions then. He'll probably have a bit of a break during the summer while the ground is like it is. 21-06-24

runners.name: Al Nayyir
runners.comment: Big shout if returning to 2024 form; 2025 Dubai Gold Cup was disappointing on latest start
runners.spotlight: Runner-up last year in the Dubai Gold Cup in March and Group 2 at York (both 2m on good) in August, but he lost his wide-margin Listed win at Newmarket (2m, soft) due to a banned substance; big shout if returning to that form but the Dubai Gold Cup in April was a disappointing latest start this term.

quotes.race: Jockey Club Rose Bowl Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: "He's a very exciting stayer and I couldn't have been more thrilled with the way Al Nayyir did it. We've got him in on Champions Day and that would be the logical next step but I'd love to avoid Kyprios if we could. We love to have these Stakes horses and that's the direction we want to go. I'm thrilled to have the owner's support and to train a horse of this calibre" - Tom Clover, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Hamilton Lonsdale Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: It was a really good run. Al Nayyir is a new horse to us but he'd shaped up well in his home work. I couldn't quite believe the price he was. He had some very good form and he has a very high rating. Hopefully he can go one better very soon. We've got him in in France and on Champions day, we'll have to discuss it with the owners - Tom Clover, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a little disappointing in Dubai, where they went no gallop and he over-travelled. We're lining up to go to Sandown at the end of the month for the Group 3 over 2m there. He took some time to come to hand over the winter but he's training well now, so hopefully we'll have plenty of fun with him during the British turf season. 14-05-25

runners.name: Burdett Road
runners.comment: 1m6f/1m7f runs last year were scuppered by racing too freely; very smart hurdle form since
runners.spotlight: Won well from the front in five-runner Listed race at Newmarket (1m4f, soft) last September, his best Flat form; attempts at big races over 1m6f and 1m7f last year were scuppered by racing too freely but his very smart hurdles form since offers hope that he may still do better in this sphere too.

quotes.race: Unibet Greatwood Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tim (Gredley) and I both agreed we were going to change tactics. We learnt a lot with Burdett Road on the Flat and wanted to make the running. He settled lovey and Harry gave him a fantastic ride. He jumped impeccably for a four-year-old and for me was just idling up the hill. It looked like he was going to get caught but when the other horse came to him he has just gone again. It was a great performance by a four-year-old in a strong race and he really wants cut in the ground. I am really looking forward to the rest of the season with him. There is a long way to go until the Champion Hurdle. Obviously on his Flat form he is more than capable of getting there. We'll aim that way and I'm not sure where we'll go next although I'm sure it will be a Graded race - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Godolphin Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Harry Davies told us we were riding Burdett Road wrong at Chester last time and he was right. He enjoyed striding on and we may have another spin on the Flat after that before he goes back hurdling - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Finesse) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It is disappointing for Burdett Road to get beaten but that is horseracing. I think we have bumped into a very good horse there and it is going to be hard to beat him in the Triumph Hurdle - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Registered As The Prestbury Juvenile Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Triumph will be the aim now. It's exciting. When Burdett Road gets good ground he'll be the real deal. We learnt a bit more about him there. We had to ride him like that. When the rain came last night I thought 'oh my god' but he's a fair animal. He's learnt a lot and he'll be exciting come March - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Twitter @betrhino Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Burdett Road did plenty wrong there but he's a good jumper and I always had plenty of horse underneath me. I'm confident he's a Triumph Hurdle horse - Harry Cobden, jockey.

quotes.race: Golden Gates Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: He was bred by the Gredleys, who have been very lucky owners, and we're delighted. The most difficult thing about training is getting the well-bred horses to walk through the door and we're lucky we've got the Gredleys. It was a much deeper race than at Newbury and we haven't done much with him, but he's a very good-looking horse and it was a good performance - Michael Bell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well in defeat in the Kingwell. He's usually an explosive jumper with a high cruising speed, but that tacky ground wasn't to his liking. We can probably look back and think giving 8lb to Golden Ace wasn't bad. He's definitely still heading to Cheltenham, but I will put him in the County as an option. He'd be carrying a big weight in that, but we could claim off him. 18-2-25

He did very well on the Flat and as a juvenile hurdler. He was favourite for the Triumph Hurdle last year but had a setback with a hind foot injury. He took a while to get back up to speed again on the Flat but finished off with two strong runs, winning a Listed race at Newmarket before running well at Ascot on Champions Day, when things didn't go to plan. The Greatwood Hurdle or the Masterton Holdings Hurdle was the plan, but we thought he was very well handicapped and would learn more in the Greatwood. Harry Cobden gave him a fantastic ride, he settled lovely in front and won nicely, and jumped well for his fourth career start in a handicap. He was then third in the Christmas Hurdle behind Constitution Hill and Lossiemouth. At Cheltenham we'll either go for the County Hurdle - having hopefully not gone up too much - or the Champion Hurdle. He's still got plenty of miles to go on the Flat and he's always been a horse we've wanted to travel with abroad. He's a lovely horse to have. 01-01-25

runners.name: Coltrane
runners.comment: Mixed results for a while but could build on last month's Ascot run
runners.spotlight: Won well on his only appearance at this track (2022); stalwart of the top staying races who was at his best in 2023 but not far off it on two occasions in 2024, in a very mixed campaign; turned over at 4-6 in Group 3 Sagaro at Ascot four weeks ago, when going for a hat-trick in that race, but he was much better last term on second compared to first start; not dismissed.

quotes.race: Longines Sagaro Stakes (Group 3) (A Gold Cup Trial)
quotes.quote: I think there was a concern whether the fire was still there, but I think it certainly was. I think Coltrane was in front longer than Oisin probably wanted to be but he was really brave there at the end. Maybe the cheekpieces sparked him up today, but he really looked well and maybe he just wasn't himself in Meydan. He's just come to himself now and he's a fighter. He loves Ascot and has run one bad race here and that's it. We'll look forward to coming back here in June. He does his own thing at home, which is not very much in the mornings. We'll let him do his own thing and he will train himself for the Gold Cup, as he did the same last year and he ran a stellar race - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Doncaster Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Coltrane put up a really top effort at York and he was unable to replicate that today. Let's hope he comes out of the race well and Andrew will decide what his next target is - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Hamilton Lonsdale Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Andrew didn't give me specific instructions and I was able to ride whatever race I saw fit. It was different from Coltrane's last two runs but he felt fantastic. He's a success story. He had a bad injury. He was beaten plenty of times before he bounced back to form but he has tremendous quality. He relaxes, has a turn of foot and can stay these long distances - Oisin Murphy, rider.

quotes.race: Gold Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Coltrane relaxed great and travelled around super. I thought I could win the race and I went to do so, while Frankie came with me. It was a really good battle and it was Frankie who came out on top - Oisin Murphy, rider.  It's frustrating but he's not let us down in any way - he's been beaten by a good horse today. The Goodwood Cup would likely be where he goes next, he ran very well in the race last year - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Doncaster Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Coltrane has done us proud as he's had a long season and we keep thinking he's going to cry enough, but he's so tough and game. We were a bit concerned about the ground because he didn't shine the last time he ran on very slow ground, but he's a star. He's a course-and-distance winner so the Gold Cup at Ascot is an obvious race for him, but we'll just enjoy today - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Marathon (Listed Race) (Registered As The Esher Stakes)
quotes.quote: Coltrane is a great horse who has been threatening to get his confidence back after a nasty injury. It has taken him a couple of runs on the all-weather to find his confidence and he's been back since the Chester Cup. He was impressive when he won the Melrose as a three-year-old and looked right back to his best there. Australia is a possibility and he'll have an entry in the Melbourne Cup, but he's in the Goodwood Cup and I think he's entitled to a crack at something like that - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: Ascot Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Coltrane jumped beautifully and I kicked to go forward and sit handy. He got me out of trouble two out and finished really strongly. When I saw Ryan Moore coming I thought 'this could be game over', but he's tough and galloped strongly all the way to the line. This horse is a yard legend and a great horse to ride - Callum Hutchinson, jockey.

quotes.race: tote+ Chester Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: We're delighted as Coltrane has run a helluva race. When you've got Ryan Moore coming up behind you - he's unbelievable. Rob [Hornby] has given him a brilliant ride and was always in the right place. He's a really special horse, who is adored by everyone in the yard, and when they come back from an injury, it means so much more - Anna Lisa Balding, trainer's wife.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Melrose Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Coltrane took a while to get his act together. He relished a bit of dig in the ground today. On paper there looked plenty in the race with an upward profile. I'm not sure what Andrew wants to do and we'll see what the owners think but options are open. I'm not sure if the St Leger might be a step too far. At his age the Cesarewitch is a very long way to go and we'd have to see what the handicapper does - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: NB Civils & Surfacing Ltd Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: That was super. Coltrane had learnt a lot from the two experiences he's had. He'll appreciate a bit more cut in the ground as he creeps through into a higher grade. He'll get further as well. He's a big, raw horse who will continue to improve, a typical one of Andrew's [Balding, trainer]. On a nice galloping track he'll pitch up into some of those big handicaps and do a nice job for the owners - Rob Hornby, rider.

runners.name: Tashkhan
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: All his wins have been on soft or heavy and none in a Group or Listed race; visor off
runners.spotlight: All his wins have been on soft or heavy going, and none in a Group or Listed race (and none at all since September 2023) although he has had form over the years which would be good enough; easily best of five runs last term was on penultimate start when a fair third in Chester handicap (2m, soft) in a first-time visor, which is absent today; plenty of reason for doubt.

quotes.race: Prix Royal-Oak (Group 1) (3yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Maybe if Tashkhan hadn't run in the Cesarewitch he could have been second. He's had all the travelling on top of Newmarket, where he had a hard race, but he's still run his heart out. We went to Chester because of ground, and we went to Newmarket because it went soft. We're governed by the ground and that's why he came here. But saying that, he's picked up over a hundred grand in three races so he hasn't done badly for a horse who cost very little money - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: Club Godolphin Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Tashkhan has run a massive race under top weight and that 4lb penalty he picked up for winning at Chester has just made the difference. We've kept him off fast ground and he's gone down fighting on a surface he loved - 'Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: Watergate Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Tashkhan is a star. The rain came and that's all he wanted, fast ground is no good to him. That just shows you how good he is. I know he hasn't won for two years but he's had some hard races. There are three races he could go for. He's in the Cesarewitch, the Long Distance Cup on Champions day and the Royal-Oak and he'll go wherever the ground is right - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix du Cadran (Group 1) (4yo+) (New & Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Ben (Robinson) just said that having run four times on fast ground, Tashkan didn't know whether he was just thinking about that (early on). He said once he got his confidence he raced a bit better. But the winner's a machine isn't he? Just a different ballgame. This is just a cheap horse and he never lets me down. We might go to Ascot and if not we'll come back here for the Royal-Oak, I think that will be more likely - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: Tashkhan is very exciting and there are lots of options now. The soft ground is key to him, he wants a bit of cut and it really makes a difference. He's entered in the John Smith's Cup but with his three-year-old weight-for-age allowance, he won't get in. There's the Melrose at York and he could run against the older horses. The two-mile races could be an option as he stayed well there-Patrick Boyle, owner

quotes.race: Follow Us On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: I would say getting gelded has made a big difference to Tashkan and he definitely has his mind more on the job. You could see that Ross was rowing away on him a long way out but he just kept galloping. Down the line I can see him making into a nice three-year-old hurdler - Emmet Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's in great form and we're just hoping for a bit of rain. He's run two good races this year, considering the ground hasn't been right for him. He loved the softer ground when he was second to Trueshan there last season and two and a half miles is tailor-made for him; all he does is stay. 08-06-22

He's in tremendous form and will probably start back next week in the Listed Further Flight Stakes at Nottingham, in which he finished third last year. He's been working great and looks a picture. He finished second in the Long Distance Cup at Ascot in 2021 and has suffered a bit since then. He had a few joint problems from running on fast ground, but they're all sorted now. He finished off last year in really good form, winning under a big weight at Chester and finishing third in the Cesarewitch, giving a stone to two very good horses [The Shunter and Pied Piper]. He was then third in the Group 1 Prix Royal-Oak but it just came too quick after the Cesarewitch. He's come back great. He'll have entries for the Chester Cup and the Ormonde and could go for the latter if the ground is on the softer side as there won't be many runners. We'll go ground hunting with him as he doesn't like fast ground - he has to have soft ground, he's a different horse altogether on it. He's likely to end up back in France at the end of the year. We'll pick out his races a bit more and the autumn is likely to be the best time for him. 03-04-24

runners.name: Trawlerman
runners.comment: Should build on his Dubai Gold Cup run and he's very much the one to beat on 2024 form
runners.spotlight: Can front-run; peak days in 2023 and 2024 saw him go head to head with the best stayers around, last term when second in the Gold Cup at Ascot; below-form favourite in the Dubai Gold Cup on his return this season but should build on that and he's very much the one to beat on 2024 form.

quotes.race: Gold Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Trawlerman was foot-perfect the whole way and when I turned in I thought I had plenty of horse. He kept finding all the way to the line and even when the winner headed me, he came back. It was a huge run and he stayed the trip. I'm sure that [Goodwood] will be his next target. The winner's been there and done it before so you've got to respect him but Trawlerman's run a mighty race - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: When he [Kyprios] passed me comfortably, I thought he was going to win by a few lengths but when he couldn't get away from me, I thought that maybe there's a little bit left here. In fairness, Trawlerman was a professional today and a great battler - Frankie Dettori, rider.

quotes.race: Jockey Club Rose Bowl Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The Rose Bowl is a nice race to win and we'll have another go at the Ascot race. Trawlerman has to go down early as he takes such a strong grip - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Ebor Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: We did that with Trawlerman's sire Golden Horn in the Arc, we did it with Muntahaa in this race and we've done it again here. Once you get that draw you should just stay out there. It works. It was very much a team decision. As soon as we got that draw we knew what we were going to do. So long as you mind your own business, you're fine. You just don't want the horse to turn right and go into the stables. You had to fancy him to run a big race after his run at Goodwood. I felt very strongly that he was the right horse for the day - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Summer Handicap
quotes.quote: Trawlerman ran last time at Newmarket and he is over generous. He leans on the rider a bit and doesn't give them much of a chance usually. Obviously he had the hood on today, which helped him a lot, but Benoit gave him a great ride and every time he felt a horse coming to him at the end, he pulled out a little bit more. We were trying to run him in a race that had a big enough field to try and get him settled. He is such a genuine horse, he gives you everything when you ask for it. Hopefully the hood relaxes him a bit and lets him enjoy the quality he has - Thady Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF "High-Rise" Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Trawlerman has obviously learned from his first two runs and he was pretty push-button round there, it was a nice step forward - James Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Ombudsman
runners.comment: 4-4, all last term and ending with French Listed race and Group 3; more in the tank
runners.spotlight: Unraced at two; unbeaten in four starts last term, with two novice wins followed by a Listed race at Deauville (1m2f, good) and seven-runner Group 3 at Longchamp (1m2f, soft); odds-on for last three of those; quickened to the front last time once the gap opened and then looked as if he had more in the tank; should make his mark in big races this term.

quotes.race: Prix du Prince d'Orange (Group 3) (3yo) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: At halfway you were relying on things to happen from where I was. Luckily, they did happen. Ombudsman will be far better off a stronger pace. Every horse is better on better ground but he did it again today and I think he won with a good bit up his sleeve. I don't think we can stand here and say how far he will go. He's gone so far already, so I see no reason why he won't go further. He's a great-to-look-at individual - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Prix Nureyev (Listed Race) (3yo) (Round Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: That was an Irish-English race. I've never seen them go that fast around here in a three-year-old race. Ombudsman did it well and he's a lovely horse but not one to overrace this year. It will be all about next year - John Gosden, joint-trainer

quotes.race: Bedford Lodge Supports Racing Welfare EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They went a good pace and Ombudsman was green early on before getting the hang of it late on. He found a lot off the bridle and Benoit said he'd get further - Danny Harrap, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Persica
runners.comment: 1m Group 1 (22-1) 12 days ago is not the hardest to forgive but this also looks tricky
runners.spotlight: Won last term over 1m2f in two handicaps and a Listed race, before another step forward for Group 3 honours over 1m1f at Newmarket this April; well beaten at Newbury 12 days ago and while that performance in a 1m Group 1 (22-1) is not the hardest to forgive, this company also looks tricky.

quotes.race: bet365 Earl Of Sefton Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Persica will go to Newbury [for the Lockinge] if it's soft, but he could have a good one in him later on. The owners love the game and turned down a lot of money for him, so it's a nice outcome - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: LiveScore Bet Doonside Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Persica could have done it better and my hand was forced a little bit. I was going wide and I could see Jim Crowley going to have a dream run coming through, it forced me to go when I didn't really want to. He's lasted out to the line but I wonder how fully this horse stays a mile and a quarter. He doesn't lack speed. Maybe his optimum is actually coming back a furlong. He's a nice three-year-old and he'll make a nice 4yo - Sean Levey, jockey.

quotes.race: Hong Kong Jockey Club Lester Piggott Handicap
quotes.quote: Persica was drawn 11 which was always going to be hard. We always thought he was a very good horse and he's definitely upwardly mobile. He was able to do it his way today, which was a massive advantage. He's a bit fragile mentally. I didn't think it would suit him here with the crowd and atmosphere. He's a little inexperienced but I hope as he grows up he can turn into a Group horse - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Persica is quite big but has plenty of ability. He stuck his head out when the other horse came to him and I didn't have to get very serious. He wasn't getting beat. When you look at him you'd say he's a miler all day long. He's one for next year - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I was delighted with his win in the Earl of Sefton. I think a mile and a quarter is his optimum but a fast-run mile will suit him as well, and if we get soft ground in the Lockinge I think he'll run very well. We have other horses for these big races as well but he'll do more than just fill in the gaps. He's a very, very good horse and he'll win a big one somewhere down the line. 22-04-25

runners.name: Aafoor

prev_owners.owner: Mohammed Bin Hamad Khalifa Al Attiyah
Mohammed Bin Hamad Khalifa Al Attiyah

runners.comment: Three wins in Qatar this winter but he faces a stiff task in this race
runners.spotlight: Beaten off handicap marks in the low 90s in Britain last summer; three wins in Qatar this winter and not beaten far when bidding for a big handicap prize in Saudi Arabia in February on latest outing, but stiff task in this.

runners.name: Almaqam
runners.comment: Close 3rd (Ancient Wisdom 2nd) on C&D return, hampered before finishing with more to give
runners.spotlight: Went close in 1m2f Group 2 at Longchamp (soft) in October; looked set for further improvement and still does following his close third in Group 3 Gordon Richards over C&D (good; Ancient Wisdom second) five weeks ago, pushed along firmly from 3f out and hampered before finishing with more to give; a stronger pace at this trip will help him and he's one to note.

quotes.race: Chasemore Farm Stud Staff Heron Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was quite taken by Almaqam. The ground was very soft today but you've got to handle it and he's got a beautiful pedigree. That's only his third start today so you'd imagine he would really progress and he's certainly got the ability. You have to stamina in that ground and I see him as a ten furlong horse in time - William Buick, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's the apple of my eye, is in good nick and heads to Sandown for the Gordon Richards Stakes next week. He's very exciting. He was only narrowly beaten by the ill-fated Jayarebe at Longchamp and I'm really looking forward to a big season with him. I think he's the real deal and can bridge that gap required to make him a top-class racehorse. He'll probably stay at 1m2f and is best with a bit of ease in the ground. 16-04-25

runners.name: Ancient Wisdom
runners.comment: Bold show from the front in Group 3 over C&D (good) five weeks ago, with Almaqam close up
runners.spotlight: Ran poorly on reappearance at Newbury last month, with the ground (good, good to firm in places) possibly to blame, but he put up a bold show from the front when dropped back to 1m2f for the Group 3 Gordon Richards here (good) 13 days later; Almaqam finished at his quarters in the latter after trouble in running and William Buick switches to Military Order this time.

quotes.race: Bahrain Trophy Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We were quietly confident as Ancient Wisdom was the class horse in the race and was racing on ground that we know he relishes. The plan from here is to head to the Voltigeur if the ground is right and plan our way to the St Leger. He is an autumn horse and we won't jeopardise that by running him on unsuitable ground - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Dante Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: We're happy and most importantly, Will [Buick, jockey] said Ancient Wisdom handled the ground. We were confident we'd handle it, but when you bring extreme conditions he excels in it. Trip-wise he's crying out to step up in trip and he'll come forward for this - he's having a good heave for one of ours. We'll let it all settle down as it's only two and a bit weeks and see how much he progresses from this. He'll come forward a good bit and a mile and a half is definitely his trip. A galloping track [at the Curragh] will be his. We feel a more sterner test suits, whereas Epsom you can be a mile and a quarter horse and win, because you have to be able to travel. This horse will come on a lot and allowed himself more time in the spring than Arabian Crown did - he's still coming in his coat - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Kameko Futurity Trophy Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: That was worth the wait. You don't want anything like that to happen but Aidan's horse looked like he got up okay, that's the main thing. We couldn't be more delighted. We thought Aidan's other horse was going to go forward and when he wasn't there Will (Buick) did his own thing. We know Ancient Wisdom stays and the plan was always to be handy. Charlie always had this race slightly in the back of his mind but he wanted to see how the horse was, and he's been pleasing him and we know he handles soft ground so we gave it a shot. He's very exciting. I think he'll be a horse who's going to want a trip next year. We've obviously got a very good one to beat in the Guineas so we'll see how he progresses over the winter and see how we go - Alex Merriam, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Emirates Autumn Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We were disappointed that we were beat at Ascot, but that race worked out so well you couldn't really be disappointed. I've probably mismanaged Ancient Wisdom running him back at Newmarket. Next year, I do feel a mile and a quarter will be within his compass and I think he will appreciate going a mile and a half. He is a Dubawi and as we know with those middle-distance type Dubawi's you can't force them too much in the spring of their three year old career so therefore something like a Dante might be a target for him. Whether we take a run before the Dante we will just see where we are in the spring, but we have a long winter ahead of us now. It is nice to be able to put these horses to bed on the back of an impressive victory - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They went no pace so I thought I'd teach Ancient Wisdom something and he finished off well - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: GPW Recruitment Carl Foster Memorial EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were expecting Ancient Wisdom to run a very good race and he's done that and a bit more. He went to sleep a little round the turn but once we straightened up I asked him to show a bit of interest and he jumped into the bridle and showed a good kick, hitting the line good. I'd say it was everything you would look for in a debut of a potentially smart horse - James Doyle, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Bolster
runners.comment: Usually front-runner; three handicap wins last year before a narrow Listed win in November
runners.spotlight: Usually front-runner these days; three handicap wins last year before he narrowly took a Listed race at Newmarket in November, all over about 1m2f on soft or good to soft; weakened into fourth in a Chester Group 2 three weeks ago but a return to peak form might still be good enough for only a place.

quotes.race: Coral "Daily Rewards Shaker" Handicap
quotes.quote: The ground is key with Bolster. He's probably pounds ahead of himself on soft, even heavy ground. It makes such a difference. He stays so well. When he runs on good ground the speed horses just have that extra gear, but from three out today he was away and there was no stopping him. We'll speak to connections but it'll be likely one more or no more runs for him this year - James Cowley, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: Betfred Nifty 50 Handicap
quotes.quote: I'd say Bolster is a Group 3 horse - that's where we'll go, but he wouldn't want fast ground. We'll have a good look at an autumn campaign for him - Karl Burke, trainer.

runners.name: Ciceros Gift
runners.comment: Came from last to third in the last 2f of eight-runner Group 2 here (1m, good) on return
runners.spotlight: Somewhat underwhelming last season after winning first time out; had gelding and wind operations and reappeared with an eyecatching performance in eight-runner Group 2 here (1m, good) five weeks ago, staying on from last to third in the last 2f; he needs better still and has never been this far but it now looks worth a shot.

quotes.race: Coral Challenge (Handicap)
quotes.quote: To go and win today is testament to the horse as Cicero's Gift wasn't fully wound up. The soft ground is important to him as he had bone bruising on all four fetlocks last year. We have a bit of money in the pot now so we may have to supplement him for something - Charles Hills, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been off since the St James's Palace Stakes with a joint problem, but he's done well and is sound now - he's been trotting for the last few weeks and looks great. He's got a lovely mind and this time last year we were really excited about him - he's very talented. He probably won't run until June or July and we'll start in a conditions race over a mile, if one exists. 17-04-24

He was one of the talking horses going into Royal Ascot after winning his first three starts. He isn't very exuberant at home and when you watch him he does nothing flashy. He's so laid back and just does what you ask. We had him out nice and early this year and he won a Wolverhampton novice on his return. That was pretty much what we expected and he then went to Goodwood for a strong conditions race over a mile, which he won very nicely again. On the back of those wins we went for the St James's Palace on Tuesday, although he could only manage seventh on the day behind Paddington. He's a strong, athletic type like his dad, but a little bigger than him. It's an unusual route to this race but on what he's done it was the next logical step. He's clearly effective over a mile but I think he should get 1m2f later on. 21-06-23

runners.name: Enfjaar
runners.comment: Won top handicap at York last July and close 2nd to Persica in Listed race; may do better
runners.spotlight: Won top handicap at York last July, pipped at Glorious Goodwood and close second to Persica in Listed race at Ayr, all over about 1m2f; may well be the type to raise his game again this term, which is needed.

quotes.race: John Smith's Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Enfjaar had bone bruising among some other things last year, but Jack rode him in work last week and he looked good. This was a tough race, though, but we won it two years ago with a horse who went and won a Group 1. I'm not saying this fella will, but I hope he will! We'll reassess and see where they put him, but he'll probably be out of handicaps and into Group races now. There's lots of lovely races in Britain and abroad. He's exciting - Richard Hills, owners' representative.

stable_tour.quote: He came back sore from Ayr on his last start but he's had a long winter off and is fine now. Physically he's done really well for his break and I'm working back from the Wolferton at Royal Ascot with him. We've been lucky to win that race a couple of times and I think he has a really good profile for it. Ten furlongs at a track like Ascot should be made for him. 11-04-25

runners.name: Military Order
runners.comment: 379-day absence before winning stylishly in a Listed race at Kempton (1m2f, AW) in April
runners.spotlight: 379-day absence proved no obstacle when he came from off the pace to win stylishly in a Listed race at Kempton (1m2f, AW) in April; last three of his wins have been on AW but he's close to the best of these in form terms and William Buick rides him instead of Ancient Wisdom.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Magnolia Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Military Order is a big horse who's probably taken a bit of time to come into his own. It's the first time I've been on him for a while and he feels a much stronger version of himself. He'll improve for this as Kempton is one of the sharpest tracks he's been round. It can be tricky when you're out of position here, but he travelled supremely well - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: BetUK Winter Derby Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Military Order was a bit cute last time, so Charlie [Appleby, trainer] said to run him quiet off the bend and he came back strong. It's a nice prize to win and it's nice that he's stepped up on his form in the trial. He's always been a talented horse and could go back to a mile and a half easily - Danny Tudhope, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfred Derby (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Military Order just didn't run his race. I suppose that can happen sometimes. I thought I would follow Frankie through. He was relaxed but all in all it was a bit disappointing. You find when they are not travelling or running a race it is normally a case of them not handling the track - William Buick, rider.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Lingfield Derby Trial Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Military Order had to overcome a race around a track that at this stage of his career, doesn't really play to his strengths. As soon as I was in position he was there for me, he's a very balanced horse. He's come through this test great and did everything right. It's another tick in the box for him - William Buick, rider, speaking on ITV.

quotes.race: Darley Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We could think about the Lingfield Derby Trial for Military Order and I don't think he wants that ground, but he's a nice horse. He's a similar stamp to his brother [Adayar]. He's big horse, so I don't think he'd want rock-hard ground, but it's rare big races are run on it - Alex Merriam, assistant trainer

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Future Stayers Novice Stakes (Sire And Dam-Restricted Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Going up from the seven furlongs to the mile was going to put us where we needed to be. Staying is going to be Military Order's forte. For a horse who got into a bit of a race for a moment he soon put it to bed when he hit the rising ground. I think he is still a big baby, he still hasn't got a clue to be honest. He is a typical horse that finds life very easy at home. He goes up and down the hill there and finds it very easy. I feel there is plenty more improvement to come. He has got the same profile as Adayar now as he finished fourth first time then won - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

runners.name: Phantom Flight
runners.comment: Dual Listed winner; even his best form is not quite a match for today's rivals
runners.spotlight: Dual Listed winner; scored twice (1m1f/1m2f) in Bahrain in January, before two lesser efforts there and a sixth of 11 when dropped back to 1m for a Listed race at Ascot; while not disgraced in the latter, even his best form is not quite a match for today's rivals.

quotes.race: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Steventon Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We bought Phantom Flight for the Bahrain International and just wondered whether he'd end up being rated high enough but he certainly will be now. He looks a really exciting recruit and the boss, Shaikh Nasser, gets all the credit. He lets me try and find horses wherever I can and he's so supportive and willing. He came to me in great condition and James Horton did a great job with him last year. We'll work back from Bahrain and I was thinking about the Ebor before then but the handicapper will have his say now. I'm going to have to slightly reevaluate now but he's a serious horse - George Scott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: His first preference is the Golden Gates over a mile and a quarter. He's hit the line well in all his races and the longer trip may eke out a bit of improvement, which we'll need. He's done little wrong and if he gets a nice draw he could be competitive. He's only had three runs but he's sensible and relaxed and he's straightforward in his races. 08-06-22

runners.name: Bay City Roller
runners.comment: Made it 3-3 in Group 2 Champagne Stakes last September; strong contender despite penalty
runners.spotlight: Won novice races last summer on first two starts (7f, good to firm/AW; including here) and made it 3-3 in Group 2 Champagne Stakes at Doncaster (7f, good) in September; absent since and carries a 5lb penalty today but nevertheless holds strong claims if returning at the top of his game.

quotes.race: Betfred Champagne Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Sadly John and Thady's horse came out the front and blasted the race apart slightly with the pace angle but Bay City Roller got some pace to aim at and travelled great, it was a very pleasing run. He's a really genuine horse. He's done everything he needed to today. Stiffer tests await him but it will be fascinating to see how he gets on. I quite like the Lagardere for him because he's very well balanced - George Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: IRE-Incentive, It Pays To Buy Irish Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It's never easy giving a penalty away, especially when you've got some strong connections in the race. I felt he needed some more game time under his belt before we stepped up into Pattern company and he got it. He had to get down and fight a very nice prospect, who's bred to go on the surface. He knows how to get down and dirty and that's going to stand him in great stead moving forward. Shaikh Nasser is obviously a major patron of the yard and has some nice two-year-olds. Bay City Roller has been working in among those, so he's seen the horse throughout the year. When he went to Sandown and won nicely, he inquired whether he might be for sale and it turned out he was. I don't want to run him with firm in the going description. His mum loved cut, he's got quite big feet and he'll be a different horse on soft ground. I'd say the Champagne is very much on his radar. From there, it will be a question of whether it's a sales race or a Group 1 - George Scott, trainer.

runners.name: Jackknife
runners.comment: Narrow debut win at Epsom; half-brother to top-class Defoe; could have lots more to offer
runners.spotlight: Strong in the betting when beating his market rival by a neck on last month's debut at Epsom (8.5f, good); others have much better form but this half-brother to his top trainer's Group 1 Coronation Cup winner Defoe could have lots more to offer and is an interesting contender.

runners.name: Matauri Bay
runners.comment: Group 2 runner-up here last August; down the field in Craven but may have needed the run
runners.spotlight: Won on debut at Leicester (7f, good to firm) last August and runner-up to subsequent Irish 2,000 Guineas winner Field Of Gold in the Group 3 Solario here (7f, good) later that month; well beaten in heavy-ground French Group 1 last October, and same story on reappearance in the Craven (1m, good), but he may have needed that latest run and it's too soon to write him off.

runners.name: Nebras
runners.comment: Listed runner-up latest (beaten 3l); needs to find something extra but he's with top yard
runners.spotlight: Won on debut at Newmarket (1m, good to soft) last October and down the field in Group 1 Futurity (1m, soft) later that month; runner-up on both starts this year (1m/1m2f, AW/good), most recently beaten 3l in four-runner Listed race at Newmarket; needs something extra but he's still lightly raced for a top stable that has won this four times since 2010, and headgear goes on.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: John and Thady Gosden expected Nebras to finish second or third, so he's surprised us a bit. Whether he runs again this year we don't yet know - Teddy Grimthorpe, racing manager to the owner.

runners.name: Opera Ballo
runners.comment: Impressive on AW on first two starts; pulled hard when sixth in Craven; retains potential
runners.spotlight: Impressive at Kempton earlier this year on first two starts (1m, AW); merely sixth of nine on turf debut in the Group 3 Craven at Newmarket (1m, good) last month but pulled hard and the first-time hood could help him settle better; retains considerable potential for top trainer.

quotes.race: "European Road To The Kentucky Derby" Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Opera Ballo was very smooth. I was very pleased with him. I do think he's a work in progress, but it's all there for him - William Buick, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Unibet Supports Safer Gambling Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Opera Ballo is a beautiful horse. Just watching him going around the paddock was nice and he really impressed me with the way he went about his business. He was very professional. He jumped with the blind, but he got away lovely and I managed to find a nice slot. He was still actually quite green, he overraced a little bit, and he'll probably be better with a little bit of cover going forward, but from the gate it was all about getting him out and into a rhythm. When I asked him to stretch at the two pole, he lengthened away quite quickly and gave me a nice feel. I think another run with experience would definitely benefit him, especially if the option was there to get a mile on some turf. I think it would help getting him to switch off early ? we've seen his finishing kick ? and it could enhance that - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Pellitory
runners.comment: Listed flop at Newmarket last time but progressive previously and he's not written off
runners.spotlight: Progressive last year, winning a nursery at Doncaster (7f, soft) last October on final 2yo start, and continued the good work with reappearance win in conditions race at Newmarket (7f, good); flopped in Listed race there subsequently (7f, good) but he's much better than that and is not written off.

quotes.race: bet365 EBF Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Pellitory is a massive horse who has done all his work with Wimbledon Hawkeye [stable companion]. We've had this race planned the whole season and you get here and think it's a strong race but it was a learning curve today to see whether we were a handicapper or a bit better. He's got a French Guineas entry and we'll think about it but he's a lovely horse with a great future - James Owen, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely, big horse who's 16.2 hands. He had quite a few runs as a two-year-old, learning all the time, and James Doyle really liked him when he rode him to win at Doncaster last time. He's done quite a bit of his work with Wimbledon Hawkeye and I think he's really smart. We were probably getting him wrong as he's more of a 7f horse than a mile performer, and he'll start back in a nice handicap or a Listed race, probably at one of those early Newmarket meetings. I hope he's more than just a handicapper. 01-01-25

runners.name: Suhail Star

prev_owners.owner: Mohammed Bin Hamad Khalifa Al Attiyah

runners.comment: Two wins in Qatar in February but looks to face a tough task on this first British start
runners.spotlight: Two wins in Qatar in February (6.5f maiden and 7f handicap) and runner-up in conditions race there (10.5f, good) in April; however, looks to face a tough task on this first British start.

runners.name: Alkuwarrior
runners.comment: Six races, with sole win coming in a maiden at Yarmouth; up against it today
runners.spotlight: Built upon previous promise to win Yarmouth maiden (5f, good to firm) on fourth start; hasn't run badly when sixth in novice races the last twice but he's up against it today.

runners.name: Clear Force
runners.comment: Easily made all on second start, beating a subsequent Listed winner; high in calculations
runners.spotlight: Clear second on debut at Musselburgh then easily went one better at 1-4 at Ripon (5f, good; made all), beating the newcomer Secret Hideaway who was a Listed winner next time; trainer won this in 2017 and 2023 and he has to feature prominently in calculations.

runners.name: First Legion
runners.comment: Won in good style over 6f at York on debut; highly likeable prospect; respected
runners.spotlight: 500,000gns breeze-up buy who was strong at the finish when winning with something to spare on debut at York two weeks ago (6f, good to firm; 6-1); this drop in trip isn't an obvious positive judged on that initial evidence but he's a highly likeable prospect who is entitled to plenty of respect.

quotes.race: Frank Whittle Partnership ebfstallions.com Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: First Legion had breezed very well and was bought with a big reputation. He was a little bit keen in the middle of the race, but he picked up good. He came from a good breeze-up place and he'll improve on good, fast ground - Shane Foley, rider.

runners.name: Kamakameleon
runners.owner: Hold My Beer, M Broughton & T Elphick
runners.comment: Clear with the second when winning at Doncaster; others have more substance to their form
runners.spotlight: Promising sixth of 17 when just 9-2 for the Brocklesby (5f, good to soft) and returned to Doncaster with a win 12 days ago on his second start (5f, good to firm); pulled clear with the second last time and is open to further improvement, but others have a bit more substance to their form.

runners.name: Anthelia
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Lxiv Mrs L Millman
runners.comment: Takes on males for the first time but she's 2-2 and could well be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Won with something in hand on debut at Bath (5f, good to firm) then narrowly defied a penalty at Salisbury (5f, good to firm); now takes on males for the first time but this unbeaten filly could well be in the mix.

quotes.race: Happy Birthday Lynn Cullimore British EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Anthelia had been showing us she was a nice filly from early on in the year and we've been waiting to get a run into her. She's been straightforward and hopefully has a nice future. She's in a couple of sales races, and while it's very early in the season, she can't do any more than she did today in a race that had a few fancied types. We could look at the conditions race at Salisbury [May 4] or the Marygate at York [May 16] next -  Rod Millman, trainer

runners.name: Eskimo Pie
runners.comment: Showed good pace when second over 6f on recent debut and she's open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Has a precocious pedigree and she belied market weakness when 1l second of six at 12-1 on recent debut at Newmarket (6f, good to firm), showing good pace before being overhauled by a blue-blooded Godolphin newcomer; open to improvement and could enjoy the run of the race from the rail draw.

runners.name: Sayidah Hard Spun
runners.comment: Won in good style at Kempton on second start; could have a part to play now upped in grade
runners.spotlight: Kept on for promising fourth on debut at Ascot (5f, good to firm) then won by nearly 2l at Kempton (6f, AW) last Wednesday; saw the trip out well last week but didn't look short of pace and this stiff 5f may be a good fit; could have a part to play now upped in grade.

runners.name: Smart Hero
runners.comment: Two wins at Wolverhampton early this year but well beaten in a valuable Newcastle race
runners.spotlight: Upped in distance for two wins at Wolverhampton (8.6f/9.4f) early this year, with plenty in hand on second occasion but he was well beaten off this 9lb higher mark in a valuable Newcastle race 11 weeks later; has a little bit more more to prove back on turf as well.

runners.name: Whip Cracker
runners.comment: Lesser shows on last two starts (the Lincoln and Thirsk Hunt Cup) and headgear goes on
runners.spotlight: No win since a novice event as 2yo but best efforts last term give him a shout, as does his good run in a warm AW race on 2025 return; two lesser shows have followed (the Lincoln and Thirsk Hunt Cup) and headgear goes on.

stable_tour.quote: He ran really well in the spring and went to Royal Ascot, where he ran really well off top weight, although he was jarred up on the quick ground. On nice ground, 1m2f will be right up his street. 18-09-24

runners.name: Alpha Crucis
runners.comment: Should have benefited from reappearance but he's of most interest on soft or heavy
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row on heavy at Goodwood (1m1f/1m) in the autumn; reappeared with a respectable eighth in the Lincoln at Doncaster (good to soft) and should have benefited from that but he's of most interest on soft or heavy.

runners.name: Hafeet Alain
runners.comment: 3lb lower than when he beat his 16 rivals at Newmarket in April 2024; remains of interest
runners.spotlight: 3lb lower than when he beat his 16 rivals at Newmarket (1m, good) in April 2024; that was his first run of the season and he showed enough on occasions afterwards to be of interest at the same juncture this time round.

quotes.race: Mutasaabeq New For 2024 Handicap
quotes.quote: Hafeet Alain usually likes to make the running but Saffie thought they were going quick enough so took him back. The team are in great form and long may it continue - Ed Walker, trainer.

quotes.race: #weareracing Handicap
quotes.quote: Connor Planas gave Hafeet Alain a peach of a ride out in front as we thought there would be no pace. He won on the Rowley Mile before I trained him so obviously likes the undulations - Ed Walker, trainer.

quotes.race: Chief Sean Brice 30 Year Retirement Handicap
quotes.quote: Hafeet Alain doesn't want it quick so this ground was good for him and we may well take him to Dubai after that - Adrian Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Thoroughbred Marketing Handicap
quotes.quote: I want to get Hafeet Alain in to the Dubai Carnival, he needs to be rated 90 so I could run him in a conditions race at Newmarket - Adrian Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: This will probably be his last year and he's been a good horse for us, winning four times and running a lot of other good races. He's behind in his coat - it's been very cold here - but he doesn't want the ground too quick, so he won't be running now anyway. 16-04-25

runners.name: Sierra Blanca

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Beaten a neck in first-time blinkers last October when last seen; now tries cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Sole win (11 races) was in 2022; career-low mark when beaten a neck in first-time blinkers at Haydock (1m, heavy) last October when last seen; now tries cheekpieces but virtually all form suggests that he is vulnerable.

runners.name: Golden Ocean
runners.owner: J Kirkland & Mrs J M Ryan
runners.comment: With new yard; promising after winning a 1m maiden and handicap on last two Irish starts
runners.spotlight: Well-bred filly whose career shot forwards at Navan (1m) last autumn when she won a maiden (on good) and handicap debut (good to yielding); the latter was just a six-runner race but she did well to give the others first run and squeeze through to snatch it on the line; has since left Michael O'Callaghan (same owners); promising recruit for her new yard.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Handicap
quotes.quote: She's gorgeous. Jim Ryan bought Golden Ocean as a yearling and she's an absolute oil painting. She's a beautiful, old-fashioned looking filly and she's bred to look that way. She's out of a three-time Group-1 winner by Galileo. She has a beautiful temperament and she is very enthusiastic. She's still relatively unexposed, too. Seamie really likes her and we will look forward to her next year - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Golden Ocean had genuine excuses at both Naas and Leopardstown. She is a big filly and one we always thought of as one for next year. Seamie thinks she will go better in a better race next year going 1m2f - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer.

runners.name: Hickory
runners.comment: Timed it just right in the 17-runner Victoria Cup at Ascot (7f, good to firm) 19 days ago
runners.spotlight: Drew a blank in 2023 and 2024 but was often on the premises and he timed it just right, in the final stride, when putting the record straight in 17-runner Victoria Cup at Ascot (7f, good to firm) 19 days ago on debut for new connections; has run over this far only once (last October) and didn't shine but he's not badly treated up 4lb since Ascot.

quotes.race: Schweppes Victoria Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Saffie knows Hickory very well and she said he likes to come from behind and challenge. She rode a fantastic race. We weren't expecting him to win. We hoped he'd run a good race, but this is the icing on the cake - Martyn Booth, owner.

runners.name: Miletus
runners.comment: Behind on handicap debut at Royal Ascot (1m2f, good to firm) last June; gelded in December
runners.spotlight: Made all in a novice at Windsor (1m, soft) last May but he trailed on handicap debut at Royal Ascot (1m2f, good to firm; 40-1) in June; gelded in December and still unexposed but he needs to resume progress after 11 months off; withdrawn when the ground was good to firm at Windsor on Monday.

stable_tour.quote: He's been given a rating of 89, which should get us in the Golden Gates. He did well to win a novice from the front at Windsor last time and the form is working out well. He's out of a Galileo mare and I think stepping up to a mile and a quarter should suit him well. He's a horse I've always liked. 13-06-24

This lovely, big, strong colt has been doing well at home and is certainly catching my eye on the gallops. He's out of a Galileo mare and we'll start him off when the 7f maidens start in the next few weeks. 21-06-23

runners.name: Surrey Shadow
runners.comment: 9-1 when 4th of 21 on handicap debut in Spring Mile at Doncaster (good to soft) in March
runners.spotlight: 7f novice form was pretty useful on turf and AW; 9-1 for handicap debut in the Spring Mile at Doncaster (good to soft) two months ago and came from mid-division to have his say in fourth of 21; up 1lb but it's easy to envisage him being capable of better.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse. We've taken our time with him. He had a niggle in the second half of last year that kept him off the track after July. He ran a really nice race at Doncaster in the Spring Mile.He wasn't beaten far behind Pearl Eye and things didn't really work out for him, as often happens in those big-field handicaps. He likes a bit of cut underfoot, so we just need it to rain for him. He's training well and I'm looking forward to getting him back out again. A mile on easy ground could be right up his street but he might stay a bit further. 14-05-25

runners.name: Crack Shot
runners.breeder: Floors Farming & The Duke Of Devonshire
runners.comment: Mixed signals but William Buick (on board last time) returns for another crack
runners.spotlight: Won 16-runner handicap at the Newmarket Guineas meeting (1m, good; 1lb lower today) last May; failed to match that afterwards for Ed Walker and although his third at Kempton (1m, AW) in April looked an encouraging first run for new calculations, he flopped (reportedly lost his action) when back for the same Newmarket race 16 days ago; mixed signals but William Buick (on board last time) returns for another crack.

quotes.race: Outdoor Digital Productions Handicap
quotes.quote: Crack Shot is a nice, progressive horse. Oisin muttered something about the Cambridgeshire or the Silver Cambridgeshire so we'll see where we go, but he's definitely on an upward curve. We've always wondered whether he wanted a mile and a quarter or a mile. We were one of those people who learned nothing at Goodwood where the ground was too soft. He just doesn't want it like that - Alex Cole, representing owners Jim and Fitri Hay, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He was disappointing in the Cambridgeshire last autumn and has taken a long time to come in his coat but he's a well-handicapped horse. I hope he can progress enough between now and June to get into the Royal Hunt Cup, that's the plan with him. 25-04-24

runners.name: Arkhalia Flynn
runners.comment: Made his mark in handicaps last term; unraced on firmer than good; interesting prospect
runners.spotlight: Held up; won handicap debut over 7f on good ground last July and twice in a row over 1m on soft ground last August, before two good seconds; unraced on firmer than good; interesting prospect.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a really good season, winning three times and being placed on four more occasions. He's had a progressive profile all year. He was unlucky at Epsom last time when he was slowly away but stayed on well to be second behind Marcella. He was probably the best horse in the race. We'll probably look for one more race for him as he loves soft ground. He'll be one who hopefully steps up into the Johan/Metal Merchant shoes next year and we can aim for races like the Lincoln, Spring Cup and Royal Hunt Cup. 10-10-24

runners.name: Atlantic Gamble
runners.comment: Six wins 2024; he's not fired on either start this term but has a competitive mark
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive after moving into handicaps last year, winning six times over about 1m with varied tactics; he's not fired on either start this term but has a competitive mark if back on song.

runners.name: I Still Have Faith
runners.comment: Neck second (1m, good) last May but below form on his only two runs since (last May/July)
runners.spotlight: Good neck second off 1lb lower on reappearance (1m, good) last year but below form on his only two starts since (last May/July); competitive if he returns refreshed.

quotes.race: Mary Lofthouse Supporting Spinal Research Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Juvenile Qual')(GBB)
quotes.quote: I Still Have Faith is a big baby. His biggest problem is he's full of speed and ability. We brought him to Wetherby today because I'd like to run him in the Wensleydale Hurdle here and if we take him to the track once and then bring him back a second time, he'll think he knows exactly what he's doing.  He learned plenty the whole way round. Jack said he jumped the first two then he didn't know if he got a fright or he lost concentration but he started knocking them out of the ground. His best jumps were his last three. As much as you school them at home, they'll always learn more at the races - Ben Brookhouse, trainer.

quotes.race: Turners Amateur Jockeys' Cambridgeshire (Special Rider Conditions) (Handicap)
quotes.quote: The Doncaster Legends race was the one we wanted to win with I Still Have Faith so this is just a bonus. Fern gave him a great ride and he ran on again when he got some company - Ben Brookhouse, trainer

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV 'Confined' Handicap (For Horses With No More Than One Win)
quotes.quote: I told Stefano to ride I Still Have Faith like that as he doesn't do much in front. He broke his whip a furlong out so did it well. He will go jumping and has already schooled over a fence - Ben Brookhouse, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't get the trip on softer ground and a stiffer track at Cheltenham in the Triumph Hurdle trial, having won on his hurdling debut at Wetherby. We were intending to run him in the Wensleydale at Wetherby before Cheltenham but the meeting was abandoned. He's decent and loves good jumping ground. He'll have a break now and come back in the spring when we can hopefully find some good opportunities for him and rack up two or three wins. 30-11-23

runners.name: Seven Symphonies
runners.comment: Much better in AW novices at Southwell (1m) late last year, winning first occasion; gelded
runners.spotlight: Failed to match market expectations in his two turf races last August (heavy/good to firm); much better in both AW novices at Southwell (1m) late last year, winning on first occasion; gelded since; needs better still on this return to turf for handicap debut but they usually run well from this yard when Oisin Murphy is booked.

runners.name: Imperial Trooper
runners.comment: 12-1 when fading right out of it at Haydock (1m, good) on return, presumably needing it
runners.spotlight: Six runs last season, the best when winning a Ffos Las novice (heavy) and going close in a 7f Sandown handicap (good); 12-1 when fading right out of it at Haydock (1m, good) on reappearance, presumably in need of the race; needs to resume improvement but he is back at Sandown.

runners.name: Rockin The Boat
runners.comment: 4th of 11 in 7f handicap at Newmarket, bumped early and hanging while coming from last
runners.spotlight: Similar form in her three runs as 2yo; bit better when fourth of 11 on handicap/seasonal debut at Newmarket (7f, good) and that was a lot better than seemed likely for most of the race, as she was bumped at the start and hung markedly right while coming from a detached last; Ryan Moore (on board last time; form boosted) returns and this extra furlong will surely help.

runners.name: Bulletin
runners.comment: Reliable sort who made the frame on all six starts; needs to find a bit extra to win this
runners.spotlight: Reliable sort who's made the frame on all six starts; won on AW on his handicap/seasonal debut and transferred that form in two turf races, all three over about 1m; needs to find a bit extra to win this, though.

runners.name: Wicked
runners.breeder: S C Wood Nook Farm Pty
runners.comment: Always second behind smart prospect in Newmarket novice (1m, good) 13 days ago; potential
runners.spotlight: 600,000gns yearling with an excellent pedigree; progressive form in his three starts; always raced in second behind a smart prospect in eight-runner novice at Newmarket (1m, good) 13 days ago; needs more to win this handicap debut but he should still have potential.

runners.name: Run With It
runners.comment: Won Southwell maiden (1m, AW); last of five in Nottingham novice (1m, good) on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Started in January and won a Southwell maiden (1m, AW) on second start; last of five in a Nottingham novice (1m, good) on turf debut but he was a weak 14-1 that day and a resumption of progress can't be ruled out.

runners.name: Gloriously Sassy
runners.comment: Should stay (failed to prove it last time) but needs overall improvement on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Mixed pedigree for stamina, with dam a 1m4f-2m winner; made the frame over 7f this spring on his first two starts and made most when third in 1m novice at Wetherby on third attempt; the latter did not prove his stamina (he raced freely) but he should stay and the two who beat him that day have won since; overall improvement is needed on handicap debut.

runners.name: Winstons Warrior
runners.breeder: Lynch Bages, Camas Park & Summerhill B/S
runners.comment: Second on Kempton AW (7f/1m) on last two starts, going mighty close in handicap last time
runners.spotlight: Outsider and hung left in his two turf starts last summer; improved form to be second on Kempton AW (7f/1m) in his two starts since, off 125 days before going mighty close in a handicap last time; up 4lb and needs to show his effectiveness on turf but that run demands respect.

runners.name: Lunar Orbit
runners.comment: Settling in rear proved difficult on handicap debut (7f) and he hung badly right; hood now
runners.spotlight: Fair form on first two starts but well beaten on both since; reappearance was handicap debut at Newmarket (7f, good; weak 14-1) in which settling him in rear proved difficult and he hung badly right in the closing stages; a hood is enlisted but others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Emery Down
runners.breeder: Genesis Green Stud & Lady Juliet Tadgell
runners.comment: Still green but produced a strong run from towards rear for Kempton maiden win (7f, AW)
runners.spotlight: Neither 2yo start (on heavy/good to soft) was devoid of promise but she returned from six months off with much better to win 11-runner maiden at Kempton (7f, AW; 9-1 from 14-1) three weeks ago; still looked green but produced a strong run from towards the rear for that win and is bred to stay at least 1m; it is needed but she looks capable of further improvement.

runners.name: Virtue Patience
runners.comment: Beaten a neck in nine-runner race for handicap debut at Kempton (1m, AW) latest; up 2lb
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism in a Lingfield maiden (7f, AW) in March and beaten a neck in nine-runner handicap at Kempton (1m, AW) in early May; up 2lb but he's in the mix if the form is transferred to turf.

runners.name: Looks Fantastic
runners.comment: Better should be forthcoming now he's back up in trip for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Ran in three maidens, notably when second at Southwell (1m, AW) in March; 7f helps to explain a lesser show at Leicester (good to firm) last time, as he rallied strongly late on; indeed, his dam was a 1m4f winner; better should be forthcoming now he's back up in trip for handicap debut.

runners.name: Moonjid
runners.comment: Did not see out 1m when favourite on final 2yo start; gelded since; makes handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Ran three times last May/August, best when 5l fourth of 11 in a Goodwood maiden (7f, good to firm; 33-1) on second occasion; did not see out 1m when favourite at Thirsk four weeks later; gelded since; needs to raise his game on handicap/seasonal debut.

6:50.race_name: PricedUp.Bet EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C And D) (EBF Restricted Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Believeinthisone
runners.comment: Always behind at Pontefract in April; withdrawn after getting upset in stalls 13 days ago
runners.spotlight: 25-1 and was always behind when seventh of nine on his Pontefract debut (5f, good) last month; withdrawn after getting upset in the stalls at Hamilton two weeks ago but he was 15-2 at the time; yard is in good form and he's one to keep an eye on in the market.

runners.name: Daydreama
runners.comment: Has lots of stamina in pedigree and he's probably a longer-term prospect
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to 2m hurdle winner Tuddenham Green; dam 2m AW winner (RPR 58), half-sister to winners Horseplay (1m4f Group 2) and Devilment (1m2f/1m3f AW and useful 2m hurdle), out of 1m5f AW Listed winner; has lots of stamina in pedigree and he's probably a longer-term prospect.

runners.name: Mister Moet
runners.comment: Chased home an impressive winner at Hamilton and he sets a fair standard on that form
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to five winners including on fast and soft ground; made a low-key start at Beverley but he left that form well behind when runner-up behind an impressive winner at Hamilton (6f, good to firm); sets fair standard on that form and he should continue to improve with experience; key player.

runners.name: Our Hero Matty
runners.comment: Big improvement when fourth at Redcar on Monday and he's in the mix upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Tailed off when last of seven on Musselburgh debut but he left that effort miles behind when fourth of 13 at Redcar (5f, good to firm; 40-1) on Monday; turns out quickly over this longer trip but his dam won at 7f and he's open to more progress; in the mix.

runners.name: Showtown
runners.comment: Has several 2yo winners on dam's side and he's an interesting newcomer
