runners.spotlight: £30,000 yearling; second foal; dam 7f/7.5f 2yo winner (including German Listed; RPR 102), half-sister to winners Indian Viceroy (7f including 2yo), Mottisfont (7.5f 2yo) and Castlewarden (French 1m 2yo); interesting newcomer and he needs a close look.

runners.name: Snake Charmer
runners.comment: Plenty to like on paper and interesting to see how he figures in the market
runners.spotlight: February foal; 28,000gns yearling; second foal; dam 5.7f/6f winner (RPR 86), closely related to Group-placed 6f 2yo/7f winner Maxi Boy, is granddaughter of 1m 2yo Group 3 winner; plenty to like on paper and interesting to see how he figures in the market.

runners.name: Stoic Poet
runners.comment: Well bred but yard doesn't have a great strike-rate with 2yos; could be one for later on
runners.spotlight: February foal; £22,000 yearling; first foal; dam once-raced half-sister to winners Gustavus Weston (6f Group 2) and Kape Moss (Listed-placed 5f/6f including 2yo), out of 1m winner; yard doesn't have a great strike-rate with 2yos and he could be one for later on.

runners.name: Surgeon Commander
runners.comment: Has some speed in his pedigree and market should guide; one of two runners for yard
runners.spotlight: March foal; 13,000euros foal, 21,000euros yearling, £20,000 breeze-up 2yo; second foal; unraced dam out of maiden half-sister to US 1m1f Grade 3 winner Cassydora; has some speed in his pedigree and the betting should be informative; yard also runs Go Teejay.

runners.name: Clear Above
runners.comment: Out of a useful 2yo winner and he needs watching in market on debut
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam 6f 2yo winner (RPR 92), half-sister to 2m Listed winner Nate The Great, out of 6f 2yo/7f winning half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner James Garfield; yard 18% with 2yos here in recent years and he needs watching in market on debut.

runners.name: Ellies De Vega
runners.comment: Has fair standard to aim at on debut and is best watched
runners.spotlight: 6,000gns foal; fourth living foal; half-brother to 7f 2yo winner Heishybrid (RPR 74); unraced dam closely related to smart 6f winner James's Delight, out of half-sister to 1m4f Group 2 winner Centennial; has fair standard to aim at on debut and is best watched.

runners.name: Go Teejay
runners.comment: Son of Tasleet; one of two newcomers for the yard and market should guide
runners.spotlight: Son of Tasleet; first foal; dam 6f-1m winner (RPR 94), out of tough 1m5f-2m winning sister to useful 7f-1m5f winner Lets Roll; one of two newcomers for the yard and market should guide.

runners.name: Northern Tempest
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And M Dods
runners.comment: Has lots of speed in his pedigree and needs watching in market on debut
runners.spotlight: £6,000 yearling; sixth foal; gelded half-brother to winners Holkham Bay (5f/6f including 2yo; RPR 106), Hucklesbrook (6f AW 2yo; 82) and Warrendale Wagyu (5f; 72); dam 5f winner (including 2yo; 98), half-sister to useful 5f/6f winner Avon Breeze, out of 5f/6f winner; has lots of speed in his pedigree and needs watching in market on debut.

runners.name: Power Supreme
runners.comment: Well backed but he swerved and unseated rider soon after the start on recent Redcar debut
runners.spotlight: Well backed into 18-5 on Redcar debut (6f, good to firm) ten days ago, but he didn't get very far after swerving left and unseating his rider; that was an inauspicious start but interesting to see if money arrives for him again.

runners.name: Ingleby Emma
runners.owner: Ingleby Bloodstock Ltd And David Buist
runners.comment: Newcomer who is a stablemate to Mister Moet; best watched unless market is persuasive
runners.spotlight: £20,000 yearling; first foal; dam made frame 1m/1m2f AW 2yo (RPR 60), half-sister to winners Total Gallery (5f Group 1 Abbaye), Lady Darshaan (5f 2yo/Fillies' Mile second) and Tempest Fugit (1m5f Listed); yard also runs Mister Moet; best watched unless market is persuasive.

7:20.race_name: PricedUp Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Irish Nectar
runners.comment: Rain would be welcome, but he needed his reappearance last year; may be best watched
runners.spotlight: All his best form including three wins has come on soft/good to soft so rain would be welcome, but he hasn't been seen in seven months and needed his reappearance last year; may be best watched on this occasion.

stable_tour.quote: It was incredible that it took us so long to win with him last season, but he was just doing too much too early in his races. I told Jamie Spencer to get him settled when he ran at Nottingham, which he did, and he picked up great and won nicely. He did the same thing next time at York and should be one who progresses again this season in those big sprint handicaps. 04-04-24

runners.name: Glorious Angel
runners.comment: One win in last 33 starts and may need this after three months off as well
runners.spotlight: 2lb lower than when winning at Ripon (5f, soft) in April last year, but that was her only win in her last 33 starts; record suggests she may need this after three months off as well.

quotes.race: Ripon Silver Sprint Trophy Handicap
quotes.quote: They went really quick which sort of helped Glorious Angel to be able to find her rhythm. As I was getting towards two furlongs I said 'go', and she's quickened up well and won the race - Ethan Jones, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She joined us last autumn having won twice for Hugo Palmer over 6f. She's done very well this term, winning three on the bounce on the all-weather earlier in the year. I thought her run two starts ago when beaten less than two lengths in a Redcar handicap was a good effort and, although I have yet to speak to her owner where he'd like to go, I think she'll be trying to sneak some black type at some stage. I have no doubt she can win again and I'll be looking for a fillies-only race. She seems to be as good over 6f or 7f and goes on any ground, so we ought to be able to find her more winning opportunities. She's in a 6f handicap at Carlisle on Thursday. 30-08-23

runners.name: Hyperfocus
runners.comment: Nine wins on good to soft or slower, but off seven months and has no great record fresh
runners.spotlight: Veteran whose nine turf wins have all come on good to soft or slower, including two last summer; 2lb lower than for the latest of those but has been off seven months and has no great record fresh.

quotes.race: More Ways To Win On Betfair Handicap
quotes.quote: I spoke to Kirkland Tellwright yesterday before I rode here and he said the best ground was in the middle of the track. And walking it myself I felt the same. I think that was a massive advantage over the three runners on the stands' side. I think Hyperfocus will go for the Ayr Gold Cup and he'll probably get an entry for the Portland at Doncaster next week - William Easterby, assistant to trainer Tim Easterby.

quotes.race: 32Red Handicap
quotes.quote: Hyperfocus always had the ability. This was his first run since being gelded and sometimes they just need that to get the best out of them. I hope he'll progress from that and go and win a few nice races - Simon Kerr, travelling head groom.

quotes.race: Betfred "1400 Shops Nationwide" Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Hyperfocus had to work for it. I could ideally have done with sitting on another one's girth for an extra half-furlong or furlong, but my guy won his maiden nicely at Leicester and he has been going forward ever since - Marc Monaghan, jockey.

quotes.race: toteScoop6 Play For Big Money Today Novice Median Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: When you win a maiden like that in April, you've got to be thinking about where they might be in eight weeks. Hyperfocus will get six furlongs but maybe the Norfolk would be less competitive than the Coventry? Either way, there's plenty of water to flow under the bridge between now and then. There's a valuable 6f race at Newbury (on May 14) before then to think about - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

runners.name: Blind Beggar
runners.comment: Back off last winning mark; interesting, especially if they elect to come stands' side
runners.spotlight: Losing run up to 13, but he's back off the same mark as when winning at Bath (5f, heavy) in April last year; interesting, especially if the rain arrives and the field elects to come stands' side (drawn wide).

stable_tour.quote: We bought him at the October sales from Ger Lyons' yard with one win to his name. I've given him three runs on the all-weather since he arrived and he has won two of them at Southwell and Chelmsford. The most recent was six weeks ago and I've deliberately put him away now with a turf campaign in mind. He's effective over 5f and 6f and is up to a mark of 84, which looks quite workable. He's well capable of winning off that and hopefully improving some more. 22-03-23

runners.name: Brummell
runners.comment: Suited by a stiff finish; 4lb higher than for winning Beverley return but still improving
runners.spotlight: Suited by a stiff finish as he showed when making a successful return from five months off at Beverley (5f, good; first two clear) five weeks ago; up another 4lb, but still seems to be progressing and rain wouldn't be a problem.

stable_tour.quote: He made his debut last month at Thirsk where he showed some very good speed for a long way before getting tired. He'll have learned plenty there and I'm sure there is much more to come from him. 06-09-23

runners.name: Moonstone Boy
runners.comment: Just beaten on last month's Musselburgh return; rain and return to a stiff track helpful
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 5f on soft/heavy at Hamilton last August and ran well on his return when beaten a neck at Musselburgh (5f, good to soft) last month; rain would be in his favour, as is the return to a stiff track; has the widest stall, but that could be an advantage of they come stands' side; stable also runs Never Dark.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca With BetUK Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very straightforward. Moonstone Boy has been knocking on the door and deserved to win. Iain [Jardine, trainer] and Andrew [Mullen, regular jockey] said to me that he'd come on leaps and bounds from his first run here. He's got a lot of speed - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He's won on the all-weather and he's also run quite well on the turf but he must have soft ground. He's plenty quick enough and is a hard-knocking sprinter whose trip is 5f. We're giving him a slightly easier time and will look for races in the next wet spell. He's back on a nice mark. 26-07-24

runners.name: Never Dark
runners.comment: Has gone well fresh before and rain wouldn't be an issue; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Two wins last year, the latest off 3lb lower at Hamilton (5f, soft) in September; off 223 days, but has gone well fresh before and rain wouldn't be an issue; each-way claims.

quotes.race: cavani.co.uk The Dapper Dash For Cash Handicap
quotes.quote: Alex gave Never Dark a really good ride. He had a feather weight and not many jockeys can do that weight so we were looking for a good apprentice who can claim. And he gave him a lovely, straightforward ride. We had him in at Ripon as well but it's undulating there and it doesn't suit every horse. The key to this horse is he handles dig in the ground and he's come to himself this year. He seems to have found a bit of confidence - Iain Jardine, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Thanks The Frontline Workers Handicap
quotes.quote: Never Dark jumped really well and never saw another rival after that. He's pretty sensible within himself and could go back over six but I'd like to see him running over five furlongs on the grass. The whole family all progressed with age and over the winter he has strengthened, and I would imagine he'll take a big step forward - David Probert, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a really quick horse. He's big and takes a bit of time to get right but once you get him to full fitness he's very consistent. He won at Nottingham and then his next run at York maybe came too soon, the ground was also a bit tacky. There are plenty more nice races in him. 26-07-24

runners.name: Minnie Wildes
runners.comment: Twice held in AW handicaps after winning first two starts; may be interesting back on turf
runners.spotlight: Bolted up in her first two starts over 6f at Ffos Las (heavy) and Newcastle (AW) last year, but twice held in AW handicaps since, including on last month's Southwell reappearance (5f); needs to bounce back, though she could be interesting back on turf especially if the ground eases.

runners.name: Emeralds Pride
runners.comment: Still 5lb above her last winning mark and significant rain may pose a problem
runners.spotlight: Six wins over 5f/6f on turf including three at Beverley, so she's suited by a stiff track; still 5lb above her last winning mark, though, and significant rain may pose a problem.

quotes.race: betting.sites.ltd Promotional Sign Up Offers Restricted Maiden Stakes (Horses In Bands C&D) (GBB)
quotes.quote: The further Emeralds Pride went, the better she got. She could go that extra furlong and it might just be a little bit smoother for her over the seven furlongs. Connor Beasley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She won again at Beverley on Sunday, landing her second race there this season over 5f. She did it very well, having broken better than in previous races. She's in good form but we'll see what the handicapper does. 28-08-24

runners.name: Water Of Leith
runners.owner: Adam Mills And Jonnie Delta Racing
runners.comment: 1lb well in, but all turf wins have come on good or faster ground; rain could be a problem
runners.spotlight: Knows how to get his head in front (11 wins) and has been going well on good to firm ground this month, winning at Catterick (6f) and going down by a short head over this C&D; 1lb well in, but all six turf wins have come on good or faster ground so rain could be a problem.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice for us as a juvenile and then left for a season before joining us in July after a Carlisle win for Rebecca Menzies. He's in the form of his life and has won twice more for us, rising from 61 to 76 in the handicap. He's far from straightforward but we know his quirks. He must walk to the start and goes in the stalls without a jockey. He was carried badly left and promoted to third in the stewards' room at Windsor last Thursday. He stayed down in the area and ran another good race on Saturday when fourth at Ascot, which more than paid for his trip. He thrives on his racing and could be a Bronze Cup hope at Ayr next week. 12-09-22

runners.name: Impressor
runners.comment: Rain would be very much in his favour, but record suggests this run may be needed
runners.spotlight: All seven wins have come on ground softer than good so rain would be very much in his favour, but he has been off seven months and his record suggests this run may be needed.

quotes.race: Sam Hall Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: In the middle of the summer Impressor had a couple of near misses, he nudged up a couple of pounds and then had a couple of poor efforts. We thought maybe his chance was gone, but he does like the ground and still seems quite well in himself - Phillip Makin, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Jaimie Kerr Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Impressor is an in-form horse at the moment and Phil's horses are flying. This lad loves the ground. Before when he used to get caught on a wing like that he wouldn't really battle hard for you but he's turned a corner and he dug deep when needed - Shane Gray, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: British EBF Molson Coors Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Impressor has got loads of speed and I wouldn't be rushing to go over seven furlongs with him. He's in the Mill Reef at Newbury and that's a likely type of race to run him in - Marcus Tregoning, trainer.

runners.name: Invincible Annice
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival on last month's stable debut/reappearance; enough to prove
runners.spotlight: Her two wins for Karl Burke last year came in a Musselburgh seller (5f, good to soft) and a Hamilton novice (5f, heavy); failed to beat a rival on last month's stable debut/reappearance at Ripon and has enough to prove after that.

quotes.race: Leisure Connect EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Invincible Annice was idling a bit in front but it was tough conditions - Shane Gray, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's a nice filly who wants it really soft. She was a good two-year-old for Karl Burke, winning twice. I gave her a run at Ripon a couple of weeks ago but it was too fast for her. 21-05-25

5:50.race_name: Cumberland Show Saturday 7th June Amateur Jockeys' Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Worrals
runners.comment: Something to prove down markedly in trip on stable debut after ten months off
runners.spotlight: 1-7 for Ralph Beckett last year, the win coming in a Goodwood maiden (1m, soft); rain not an issue, but something to prove down markedly in trip on stable debut (same owner) after ten months off; market useful.

runners.name: Daytona Lady
runners.owner: Eric Broadwith And Mrs Ruth Carr
runners.comment: 1lb below her last winning mark, but would have something to prove if the rain arrives
runners.spotlight: 6-31 on the AW and 1-9 on turf, the win coming at Wetherby (5.5f, good; first-time cheekpieces) just under a year ago; 1lb below her last winning mark but she would have something to prove if the rain arrives, being unraced on ground softer than good.

quotes.race: It's Time To Turn To talkSPORT Handicap
quotes.quote: I don't think Daytona Lady liked Kempton the last day. She's been working very well at home - Darragh Keenan, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She was busy last year, racing 18 times and winning four on the all-weather so she's had break since November. She's in good shape and goes to Catterick on Wednesday over 6f. A turning six furlongs is what suits her best. She'll need to improve some if she's to achieve what she achieved last year. 09-04-25

runners.name: Annie Edson Taylor
runners.comment: Will need to step up from last month's modest Haydock stable/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and formerly Irish-trained filly whose sole win came when sent off 4-9 in an uncompetitive Bath maiden (5f, good) last September; rain wouldn't be an issue, but she will need to step up from last month's modest Haydock stable/handicap debut (behind Belsito).

runners.name: Arantes Nascimento
runners.comment: Ran well when third on stable debut this month; one of the more likely winners
runners.spotlight: 1-13, but he ran well dropped back in trip when third of eight on stable debut after 112 days off at Doncaster (6f, good to firm) this month; something to prove if the ground eases (modest effort in one start on ground softer than good), but still one of the more likely winners.

stable_tour.quote: He was very green on his debut at Thirsk last month but stayed on pleasingly towards the end. That was over 6f, so we upped him to 7f last week at Musselburgh where he finished fourth, and it was definitely a step in the right direction. 06-09-23

runners.name: Belsito
runners.comment: Two starts over C&D last summer resulted in a win and a neck defeat; high on the list
runners.spotlight: Needs to step up on last month's Haydock reappearance (first outing after a second wind operation), but two starts over C&D last summer resulted in a win (on soft) and a neck defeat (good); rain would be in his favour and high on the list under Simon Walker.

runners.name: Havana Rum
runners.comment: 5lb below last winning mark and the return to a stiffer track may help; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: 5lb lower than when winning at Pontefract (6f, good) last summer and he suggested he may be on the way back when fourth of ten at Catterick (6f, good to firm) last time; has won on soft, so rain not an issue and the return to a stiffer track may help; shortlisted.

runners.name: First Company
runners.comment: 1-27 on turf and would have even more to prove were the ground to ease significantly
runners.spotlight: Usually seen on the AW (3-24) these days; just 1-27 on turf and would have even more to prove were the ground to ease significantly.

runners.name: Run This Way
runners.comment: 6lb lower than when completing a hat-trick around this time last year; rain welcome
runners.spotlight: Little to get excited about in two starts on the AW since returning in March but 6lb lower than when completing a hat-trick over 6f at around this time last year; rain would aid her chance and worth a second look, especially if backed.

stable_tour.quote: She must be one of the fastest Cannock Chases there is around. She got her hat-trick up at Ripon last week and it's never easy to win three on the bounce. The ground was plenty tight enough there and it was just because she was in sugood form with herself that we got away with it. When Graham Lee won on her at Thirsk a couple of years ago, we thought she was going to be an 80-plus horse, but last year she underperformed all season. She was never right and we gave her a wind op over the winter. The way she was galloping, I thought she'd win first time up but she didn't. We then upped her to 7f and she ran a little bit better, but as soon as we put a bit of headgear on she was a different mare. She didn't cost a lot of money and she's paid for herself several times over. She's straightforward and easy to train, and there's more to come as on her old marks there's still a bit of wiggle room. She loves proper softground. 28-06-24

runners.name: Four Adaay
runners.comment: Only one win in her last 31 starts and this stiff 6f may also pose a problem
runners.spotlight: 5lb lower than when winning at Sandown (5f, soft) last September, but that her only success in her last 31 starts; this stiff 6f may also pose a problem, especially if the ground eases; dropped away in the closing stages at Redcar (6f, good to firm) on Tuesday.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a bit out of sorts but has become very well-handicapped. She was a very unlucky loser last month at Nottingham where she got in a bit of trouble, so she should pick up a few races between now and the end of the season. 11-07-24

8:20.race_name: PricedUp Daily Sports Boosts Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Action Pact
runners.comment: Fair run on last month's belated debut; open to improvement but may want a longer trip
runners.spotlight: Fair effort when second of five on last month's belated debut at Pontefract (1m2f, good; 33-1), albeit no match for the odds-on winner; open to improvement but this Golden Horn 4yo may want a longer trip.

runners.name: Tee Aitch Aye
runners.comment: There can be optimism he'll improve today but others have much stronger form
runners.spotlight: 4yo who made debut last month and has kept on for a fair fourth on both starts (1m, good); could improve for today's extra furlong and the stiff track, and can give a good account, but others have much stronger form.

runners.name: Cant Chant
runners.comment: Well beaten at 250-1 this spring on first two starts (1m/7f)
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at 250-1 this spring on first two starts (1m/7f).

runners.name: Push The Limit
runners.comment: A win and a near-miss from his two starts and he's a leading contender under a 7lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Won on debut at Kempton (1m, AW) last October and reappeared with neck second at Newmarket (1m2f, good) last month; represents a top southern trainer and he's a leading contender under a 7lb penalty.

runners.name: Sea The Light
runners.comment: Narrow win in small field at Newcastle on debut; open to improvement now up in trip
runners.spotlight: 15-2 when getting up late to win by a short head on debut in a small field at Newcastle (7f, AW) four weeks ago; carries a 7lb penalty today and others have more substance to their form but this Sea The Stars 3yo is open to plenty of improvement, especially now up in trip; possible player.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sea The Light's work was quite nice at home and we were quite confident coming here. He's only a baby - he's only a May foal - and we'll sit tight and give him a bit of time to mature but he'll be a nice horse in time - John Butler, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Balmerino
runners.comment: Unable to threaten over 7f last autumn on first three starts; lots of improvement required
runners.spotlight: Unable to threaten over 7f last autumn on his first three starts; tackles a new trip today but considerable improvement is required.

runners.name: Danger Bay
runners.breeder: Mrs S M Rogers & Sir Thomas Pilkington
runners.comment: Second of four in hot little race at Haydock on sole 2yo start; one to be interested in
runners.spotlight: Sole newcomer in the field when close second of four at 13-2 at Haydock (1m, good to firm) last August; absent since but that was a hot little race and this 130,000euros yearling could have lots more to offer.

runners.name: Elsass
runners.comment: Potential in pedigree and market check advised, but well beaten on sole 2yo start
runners.spotlight: Always in rear when 28-1 for last September's debut at Ayr (1m, good); his dam was a 10.5f Listed winner in Germany and it will be interesting to see if he's stronger in the betting on his comeback, but he may want further.

runners.name: Gaelic Gladiator
runners.comment: Displayed some ability last autumn but not enough to suggest he's the one to be on today
runners.spotlight: Displayed some ability last autumn on first two starts (8.3f/1m) but not enough to suggest he's the one to be on today; upset in stalls and withdrawn at Musselburgh last month (20-1 at the time).

runners.name: The Kings Falcon
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen
runners.comment: Reappeared with close second at Epsom and is in top hands to continue to progress; player
runners.spotlight: Promise last autumn on first two runs (7f/1m, heavy/AW) and returned with close second at Epsom (8.5f, good) last month; in top hands to continue to progress and every chance this trip will be within range; player.

runners.name: Tiernan
runners.comment: Makes debut in a hot novice and he may be of greater interest when tackling further
runners.spotlight: 18,000gns 3yo; by Dubawi; fourth foal; dam French Listed-placed 1m3f/1m4f winner from talented family; makes debut in a hot novice and he may be of greater interest when tackling further.

runners.name: Breizh Sea
runners.breeder: D Cherdo, C Cherdo & Haras Des Evees
runners.owner: Mrs K Oliver And Miss K Scott
runners.comment: Always behind when 100-1 on debut at Newcastle (7f, AW) in December
runners.spotlight: Always behind when 100-1 on debut at Newcastle (7f, AW) in December.

runners.name: Storm On Jura
runners.comment: 3,000gns foal; makes debut in a hot novice and may be best watched
runners.spotlight: 3,000gns foal; first foal; dam unplaced, half-sister to two French Listed winners; makes debut in a hot novice and may be best watched.

runners.name: Little Ted
runners.comment: Back on last winning mark and could be dangerous if he gets a good pace and some luck
runners.spotlight: Seven wins at up to 1m2f; never involved after slow starts in two runs (1m) this season but he's now back on last winning mark and should get a decent tow into this race; dangerous if he can rediscover his spark.

runners.name: Straya
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Has dropped a long way in weights but she's a still a maiden after 15 runs; down the list
runners.spotlight: Has dropped a long way in weights but she's still a maiden after 15 starts and she faded into fifth of eight at Thirsk (1m, good to firm) last month.

runners.name: Langholm
runners.comment: On dangerous mark but he's been out of sorts in last five runs and needs a major revival
runners.spotlight: Versatile trip-wise and effective on fast and heavy ground; well handicapped on his Thirsk win (7f) last summer but he's been out of sorts in last five runs and needs a major revival.

runners.name: Elettaria
runners.comment: Ended long losing in January but she's been quiet in last two starts; bit to prove again
runners.spotlight: Course winner who ended a long losing run at Newcastle (7f, AW) in January, but she's a frequent slow starter and has been quiet on Tapeta and turf in last two runs; bit to prove again and she needs to get back near best.

runners.name: Doomsday
runners.comment: Reappeared with Musselburgh win but his form has slumped in two subsequent runs
runners.spotlight: Acts on good to firm and good to soft; started this season with a win at Musselburgh (7f, good) but his form has slumped in two subsequent runs; only 2lb higher than for that last success but he needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Martins Brig
runners.comment: Two wins this year including from the front at Wetherby latest; big player again up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Plenty of good efforts this year, including a win at Newcastle (1m, AW) in March and another front-running success at Wetherby (7f, good to firm) last time; up 3lb for that narrow win but he still looks feasibly treated and won't mind what the weather does; key player.

runners.name: Going Underground
runners.owner: H S Hutchinson And W Glass
runners.comment: Overall record of 2-42 and he's struggled in last two runs; others are more convincing
runners.spotlight: Didn't get any luck when fifth behind Martin's Brig at Wetherby last month but he's struggled in both runs since and his overall record now stands at 2-42; others are more convincing.

runners.name: Lockdown Lass
runners.comment: Only four runs since 2023 and she's been well held in all of them; needs to raise game
runners.spotlight: All four wins have been on slow ground but she's only had four runs since 2023 and has been well held in all of them; mark continues to fall but she needs to significantly raise her game back in trip.

runners.name: Wheres The Crumpet
runners.breeder: A F G & Mrs S L Brimble
runners.comment: On last winning mark and was back to form at Newcastle latest; one of three for yard
runners.spotlight: On last winning mark and she returned to form with a front-running third in classified event at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) in March; has claims if she can back that up after a break and the second of her three wins was on turf; stablemate of Martin's Brig and Top Gun Tina.

runners.name: American Star

prev_owners.owner: Old Gilroyders And Mrs R Carr

runners.comment: Well treated on Chester win last summer and showed signs of a revival latest; in the mix
runners.spotlight: 0-14 since his Chester win (7f, good to soft) last summer but that was off 19lb higher and he showed signs of a revival with his fourth at Wolverhampton (8.6f) two weeks ago; looks interesting if he can build on that and he's in the mix back in trip.

stable_tour.quote: Not much has gone right for him since he won at Chester in July of last year, but at least that means he's well handicapped. Ideally he wants a bit of give and a turning seven furlongs. He runs at Catterick on Wednesday. 09-04-25

runners.name: Superior Council

prev_owners.owner: R Howard & M McCauley & J F Levins

runners.comment: Longstanding maiden who is 0-13 on turf; probably best watched on stable/seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who ran well in two Irish handicaps (6f/7.4f) in the autumn but he's not easy to predict and was well held in final run last term; returns for new yard after 219 days off and others are preferred.

runners.name: On The Bubble
runners.comment: Has generally struggled this year and was only fifth of seven at Ayr latest; passed over
runners.spotlight: Won on the Flat (1m) last May and over hurdles (2m, also on soft) last June; well handicapped on her best Flat form but she's generally struggled this year and was only fifth of seven at Ayr last time; passed over.

runners.name: Top Gun Tina
runners.comment: 0-18 but was an eyecatcher at Ripon last time and she's a player if she can build on that
runners.spotlight: 0-18 but was an eyecatching fourth at Ripon (1m, good) last time and that can be marked up but she got hampered after a slow start; has possibilities if she can build on that and she's an interesting contender; one of three runners for yard.

runners.name: Hill O Rue
runners.owner: Gordon Bulloch & S Hardcastle D Szepler
runners.comment: Placed this spring in his first two handicaps; today's race could be a good opportunity
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on handicap/seasonal debut at Redcar (1m, good) last month then again ran well when third at Ripon (1m, good); could do with settling better than last time now up in trip but this may be a good opportunity.

runners.name: Belabambina
runners.comment: Close sixth in AW novice in March but down the field since in first two handicaps
runners.spotlight: Close sixth at 150-1 in Wolverhampton novice (7f, AW) in March but down the field since in her first two handicaps (7f/1m, AW/good to firm); needs to raise her game.

runners.name: Nippasso
runners.breeder: Susan E Mason & Mr S A Hollings
runners.comment: Yet to threaten but didn't run badly on handicap debut and she's open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Yet to threaten but didn't run badly when sixth of nine on her recent handicap and seasonal debut at Ripon (1m, good) and she's a possible improver now tackling 1m1f at a stiff track.

runners.name: Tootsie
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on handicap debut but made some late headway and this is a stiffer test
runners.spotlight: Beaten 9l at 33-1 when seventh of 12 on last month's handicap and seasonal debut at Nottingham (8.3f, good to firm) but she made some late headway and the extra yardage at this stiffer track could be a positive.

runners.name: That Lucas Fella
runners.comment: Back to form when runner-up in AW handicap last week and he's on the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Disappointing in the main since encouraging fourth in novice here (6f, soft) last August on second start, but he returned to form when runner-up in Wolverhampton handicap (8.6f, AW) last Thursday; on the shortlist.

runners.name: Havachoc
runners.breeder: The Rumble Racing Club - White Chocolate
runners.comment: Weakened over 11.6f on handicap debut and today's shorter trip could be a good fit
runners.spotlight: Made debut at Southwell (7f, AW) last month and showed some ability; well beaten the next twice (both 7f), but he weakened on handicap debut at Haydock (11.6f, good to firm) 19 days ago and today's shorter trip could be a good fit for the time being; not ruled out.

runners.name: Sweet Cicely
runners.comment: 0-12 but she's made the frame in handicaps on her last three starts; might not be far away
runners.spotlight: 0-12 but she's made the frame in handicaps on her last three starts (1m/9.4f, AW/good) and is edging down the weights; might not be far away.

runners.name: I Got Know How
runners.comment: Fair efforts in 6f handicaps this year but below par over 7f latest; now tackles 1m1f
runners.spotlight: Fair efforts in 6f handicaps on first two starts this year but a lesser run followed when back up to 7f at Redcar ten days ago; tackles an extra 2f this evening and her claims aren't compelling.

6:20.race_name: Cumberland Show Saturday 7th June Amateur Jockeys' Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Biplane
runners.comment: Remains 5lb above her highest winning mark and wouldn't want too much rain ideally
runners.spotlight: Faced a near-impossible task from 9lb out of weights at Newcastle (7f, AW) last time but remains 5lb above her highest winning mark; has run well on good to soft, but wouldn't want too much rain ideally.

runners.name: Sir Garfield
runners.comment: Most starts over 7f, but this could become a stiffer test if the rain arrives
runners.spotlight: Most of his racing (including all three wins) has been at 7f and is rarely seen over a trip this short these days, but this stiff 6f could become an even greater test if the forecast rain arrives (acts on any ground); looks interesting under Simon Walker.

runners.name: Bay Breeze
runners.comment: Has dropped 1lb below his last winning mark; major player with the ground easing
runners.spotlight: Not as good as he was but hasn't been disgraced in three starts over 6f on good ground since returning last month and has dropped 1lb lower than when winning at Nottingham (6f, soft) last October; major player.

stable_tour.quote: He trotted up at Ripon, then ran a good race at Doncaster, where the ground was too firm for him. Gelding has helped him and he's stronger now. 02-05-22

runners.name: Silent Flame
runners.comment: Acts on any ground but she has a modest record fresh so the 233-day absence is a concern
runners.spotlight: Improved for the fitting of blinkers last summer, winning at Newbury and Goodwood, though she ended the season with two quiet runs; acts on any ground, but has a modest record fresh so the 233-day absence is a concern.

quotes.race: Peter Britton 60 Years Racing At Salisbury Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Silent Flame is a nice, lovely filly with a good attitude - she'd probably be Al Kazeem's fastest sprinters. She's improving all the time and has thrived this year. She's owned by Gloria Abbey who is very enthusiastic, she's been in the game a long time and is well into her eighties. She knows more about the game than I do - Rod Millman, trainer.

runners.name: Sir Maxi
runners.comment: Four-time winner on turf and should be suited by this stiff 6f; visor on; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Two wins on the AW earlier in year (making four in all on artificial surfaces) but is also a four-time winner on turf on ground ranging from good to firm to good to soft; should be suited by this stiff 6f and shortlisted with a first-time visor replacing blinkers.

quotes.race: Betway Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Sir Maxi has been doing everything lovely at home, he does tend to be a small bit keen and he was kind of hanging out around the bends because he's trying to pull too hard and go too quick for himself. As soon as they turned in I just needed him to switch onto that right lead and as soon as he did he quickened away nicely. All he's done this year is only a bonus for what he could be next year, we've always looked at him as being a three-year-old - Rossa Ryan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Yazaman

prev_owners.owner: A Rhodes, M Short & E Twibell
A Rhodes, M Short & R Swift
J C G Chua And Partner

runners.comment: Completed a four-timer in the middle of last year, but is 0-32 over 6f and beyond
runners.spotlight: Enjoyed a fine time of it in the middle of last year, completing a four-timer over 5f/5.5f on ground ranging from good to firm to soft; just 1lb above his last winning mark but has something to prove on this stiff track being 0-32 over 6f and beyond.

quotes.race: Tattersalls July Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Yazaman ran differently to Ascot in that he jumped and travelled really well over the extra furlong, while he was a bit outpaced at Ascot. I think the winner is pretty good and we were beaten by a better horse. To give our horse some credit I don't think he saw the winner coming as he was a long way from him. He's grown up a lot since his debut and he's a grand horse, but he's an out and out two-year-old so we need to get on with him and make use of him. He didn't mind the ground today - Maureen Haggas, wife of William Haggas, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'd be a lovely person, absolute class, but he's a character, shall we say. He was a really good two-year-old when he was runner-up in the Richmond Stakes for William Haggas, but maybe he overachieved at two as quite a few of them do. He was one of those where we probably bought him at the right time as his rating was down into the 60s. He was running well without doing an awful lot, but when he got down to a mark of 50 he started winning. We put a visor on and it helped a bit, but it wasn't until he got the blinkers on that things started to happen. Even the first day he won at Nottingham, I still maintain that if he hadn't got a bump near the finish, he'd have finished second; he got a bump and seemed to take off and won really well. He then went to Beverley and had a bit of a troubled passage but got to the front and was well on top at the finish. When he went to Wetherby for his third success, the ground was plenty quick enough for him and the race didn't go as smoothly as we'd have liked, but he still won, whiwas fair play to him. He's got his confidence back and remembered how to win. If he wants to win again, he's still a long way ahead of the handicapper. He's entered at Leicester on Thursday but I'd be amazed if he runs as it looks like it's going to be a dry week. 28-06-24

runners.name: Thornaby Pearl

prev_owners.owner: Ingleby Bloodstock And Tall Trees Racing

runners.comment: Has become well treated; return to this trip should suit and rain will aid his cause
runners.spotlight: Losing run up to 14 but has become well treated and he's run well in his last three starts, as when third of seven on last month's Ripon return (5f, good) after 194 days off; return to this trip should suit and rain will aid his cause.

stable_tour.quote: A grand horse who wins once or twice every year. He could arguably win a few more. He has a high head carriage and is a real bridle horse. He travels strongly and when he gets his own way, he looks impressive. But then he gets handicapped accordingly and finds it very hard. He doesn't like the hustle and bustle, so getting out in front helps him. He likes cut in the ground - he won impressively at Doncaster in March in those conditions - and hopefully he'll be winning again. 26-07-24

runners.name: Prince Of Bel Lir
runners.comment: Quiet in his last four starts and needs to be reinvigorated by the change of yards
runners.spotlight: Six wins for Joseph Parr, the latest from 2lb higher at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) in January; acts on any ground but quiet in his last four starts and needs to be reinvigorated by the change of yards.

quotes.race: Cazoo Handicap
quotes.quote: Prince Of Bel Lir enjoyed this ground better than he did at Thirsk last time and hopefully he can build on this - Daniel Muscutt, rider.

runners.name: Giselles Izzy
runners.comment: Patchy form since latest win off 12lb higher; not quite sure what to expect
runners.spotlight: Five turf wins on good/good to soft, the latest at Ayr (6f) last August; now 12lb lower, but her form has been patchy in the meantime and not quite sure what to expect.

stable_tour.quote: She's improving and she loves Hamilton - she's won there twice this year. She got run off her feet over 5f at Hamilton last week - she was lower in the weights when she won over that trip. She finished well enough to suggest she'd have won over 6f. She's thriving and she's a hard mare, who always comes back and eats up well, so she can run quite often. 26-07-24

5:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places

runners.name: Nezeeh
runners.comment: Must have a big chance to follow up in this company with 10lb apprentice taking over
runners.spotlight: Snapped a long losing run when a clearcut winner in Cork handicap (5f, good) nine days ago; must have a big chance to follow up in this company with 10lb apprentice taking over.

runners.name: Verified
runners.comment: Repeat of respectable runs at Dundalk in the winter would give him a chance on ratings
runners.spotlight: Placed only once from 12 outings; repeat of respectable runs at Dundalk in the winter would give him a chance on ratings but needs to step up on latest Navan effort.

runners.name: Fivecromwellplace
runners.comment: AW winner; tailed off on first try at 1m2f latest; big drop in trip should at least help
runners.spotlight: AW winner (7f); finished second three times on grass but beaten out of sight on latest Leopardstown handicap; that was his first try at 1m2f; big drop in trip should at least help.

runners.name: Amanirenas
runners.comment: 5-time winner including two here; never sighted on 2 starts since return; rain won't help
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner including two at this track (all on good ground) off as high as 67; never sighted on two starts since returning; forecast rain won't help.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Members Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Amanirenas showed she was coming back to herself at Fairyhouse. She is finding her way back and is well handicapped on last year's win. She enjoys it when she is not overcrowded - Michael Grassick, trainer

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Events & Recycling Handicap
quotes.quote: Amanirenas is a filly we liked in the spring. She tweaked something in her knee last day and has had a few easy weeks, so I thought she might need the run today. She will come forward and we will try and find a nice fillies handicap - Michael Grassick, trainer

runners.name: I Bid You Ajou
runners.comment: Maiden is 0-15 but was runner-up in 7f handicaps last year; this trip looks too sharp
runners.spotlight: Maiden is 0-15 but was runner-up in 7f handicaps at the Curragh and Down Royal last year; ran well for a long way on return; found first try at this trip too sharp on latest.

runners.name: Eruption
runners.comment: Won 6f Sligo claimer around this time last year so not ruled out; new yard; visor
runners.spotlight: All three wins on turf, the latest a Bellewstown handicap (5f, good) last summer off 61; won 6f Sligo claimer around this time last year so not ruled out on return; first run for new yard; visored.

runners.name: Lismacbryan Hill
runners.comment: 20lb worse off with Devil's Angel here; plenty to find despite booking of Colin Keane
runners.spotlight: No match for Devil's Angel when ninth of 19 at Navan on latest; 20lb worse off with that rival here factoring in rider's claims; plenty to find despite booking of champion jockey.

runners.name: Devils Angel

prev_owners.owner: One In A Million Syndicate/B Sheerin/G O'Brien/K Coleman

runners.comment: Took advantage of a tumbling mark when landing 19-runner Navan handicap 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: Took advantage of a tumbling mark when landing 19-runner Navan handicap (6f, good) 12 days ago, impressively; deserves to be near the head of the market on the back of that; big player.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: We couldn't believe the price he was for a horse that won two starts ago. I know Devil's Angel is a bit hit and miss because of his minor issue with the stalls, but he was still a huge price. He loves Sandown (won both starts there) and we'll look at a choice of races at the Saturday and Sunday meeting there in two weeks' time - Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer.

quotes.race: Play 4 To Score At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a good bit of placing. There wasn't much pace on paper so I sat close and Devil's Angel gave me an easy ride. It was the right track to experiment going five and maybe he will stay at that trip now - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Thank You Dr Jerry Hill Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)

quotes.race: Come Racing Saturday 8th June Handicap

We've nothing really in the pipeline and we'll just see what comes up. He's consistent and Robbie gets a good old tune out of him. He's hot and Robbie just sits cold on him - Nigel Slevin, trainer

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Half A Chance is a nice horse. He probably wants further and the ground seems yielding, I wouldn't have run him on ground any quicker - Shark Hanlon, trainer

runners.name: Rut Daniels
runners.comment: Handicap newcomer; best form was in winning his maiden on yielding ground
runners.spotlight: Won his maiden here by 12l (2m2f, yielding) but wasn't quite so good on a softer surface next time so the recent rain perhaps not welcomed; handicap debut.

runners.name: Penny Jar
runners.comment: Now on a losing run and ran very flat after a break at Cork 19 days ago
runners.spotlight: Completed a handicap hat-trick in 2022 but now on a losing run and ran very flat after a break at Cork 19 days ago.

quotes.race: Kathleen Walsh Memorial Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: All Penny Jar does is stay and he kept at it well - Pat Downey, trainer.

runners.name: Answering
runners.comment: Didn't take to chasing and after a fall he was tailed off back over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden on heavy ground in early 2024; didn't take to chasing and after a fall he was tailed off back over hurdles at Clonmel; reservations for now and blinkers are tried.

runners.name: Happy Me
runners.comment: Two maiden efforts during the winter were encouraging with a view to this sort of mark
runners.spotlight: Beaten 24l when third in a Wexford maiden last month and had a lot to find next time; of greater interest now handicapping and his two maiden efforts during the winter were encouraging with a view to this sort of mark.

runners.name: Onefortheditch
runners.comment: Consistent mare with the form to feature and could strip fitter for her latest run
runners.spotlight: The ground was good to yielding when winning back-to-back handicaps last summer but she can cope with softer surfaces and is entitled to come on for her latest run; consistent in the main.

runners.name: Reflectionist
runners.comment: Dual winner in 2023 but nowhere near the same form since returning from an absence
runners.spotlight: Won two handicap hurdles during this month in 2023, both on good to yielding ground; however, since returning from a long absence he's not shown anything like that level of form.

quotes.race: Regeneron Ireland Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: I travelled better than I did at Punchestown, it's good ground. Reflectionist has loved the ground, he's won a bit more impressively today because of it - Sean Flanagan, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Boston Rajj
runners.comment: Only 2l away on handicap debut (2m5f, yielding) but failed to build on that at Fairyhouse
runners.spotlight: Only 2l away on his handicap debut (2m5f, yielding) but failed to build on that at Fairyhouse; still early days.

runners.name: Shadow Paddy
runners.comment: Back from a break to make successful handicap debut at Tipperary; raised 8lb
runners.spotlight: Back from a break to make successful handicap debut at Tipperary (2m1f, good to yielding) in first-time tongue-tie (retained) and had a nice bit in hand at the finish; raised 8lb but needs considering.

quotes.race: SIS Supporting Irish Racing Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Shadow Paddy is a big horse and he got light after a few runs. The lads that own him know the game and they were good to give him a bit of time and had that bit of patience. He got strong for the break and I think we'll keep going for the summer - Eoin McCarthy, trainer.

runners.name: Crowsatedappletart
runners.comment: Three-time course winner who nearly exploited his lower chase mark here last week
runners.spotlight: Three-time course winner who nearly exploited his lower chase mark here last week; might be handicapped about right over hurdles but he's in form and goes on any ground.

runners.name: Monroes Hollow
runners.comment: Beaten when falling on handicap debut and then ran moderately at Cork
runners.spotlight: Maiden efforts not devoid of promise but was beaten when falling on handicap debut and then ran moderately at Cork.

runners.name: O Bon Pardon
runners.breeder: M Emmanuel Dibatista & M Frederic Pardon
runners.comment: One of his maiden efforts reads well and blinkers now applied for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Final maiden effort wasn't his best but he was bang there in a Naas race in December and now goes in blinkers on handicap debut; could be interesting.

runners.name: Silent Selector
runners.comment: Won in a first-time tongue-tie over C&D (good) in April before pulling up at Kilbeggan
runners.spotlight: Won in a first-time tongue-tie over C&D (good) in April before pulling up at Kilbeggan; 9lb higher than for that recent win and may need the ground to remain goodish.

runners.name: Hidalgo Des Mottes
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Des Mottes
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden but ran well after a break at Cork (2m4f); mostly kept to good ground
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden but ran well after a break at Cork (2m4f), finishing just ahead of Crowsatedappletart; cheekpieces are now left off and has mostly been kept to good ground, so watch the weather.

runners.name: Avandra
runners.owner: John Paul Flynn & P J Rothwell
runners.comment: Has shown enough in handicaps to believe she might nick a race off this low a mark
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden but has shown enough in handicaps to believe she might nick a race off this low a mark.

7:42.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Native Dream

runners.name: Pirate Island

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late M J Daly

runners.comment: Best form on testing ground, not a bad effort on gd-yld latest, needs more back up in trip
runners.spotlight: 0-13 over hurdles; best form on testing ground; not a bad effort on good to yielding last time out at Gowran in first-time blinkers (retained); down 2lb but needs more stepped back up in trip.

runners.name: Donnrua Dream
runners.comment: Two-time winner on heavy, lost form, best watched on stable debut after break
runners.spotlight: Won twice on heavy ground when in the care of Gavin Cromwell; completely lost form for John McConnell and returns from a near six month break for new yard; best watched.

quotes.race: M2 Construction, Wexford Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Donnrua Dream did it well. I had a lovely position the whole way and I always felt that I was holding the runner-up. He's probably best on soft ground - Keith Donoghue, rider

runners.name: Its Time Again
runners.comment: Gained third career win off 90 latest, up 5lb, will need a career best to follow up
runners.spotlight: Finished off 2024 in good form and returned from a 153-day break to gain her third career win off 90 at Ballinrobe (21.5f, good); raised 5lb and never won off a mark this high; career best needed to follow up.

runners.name: Lucky Lioness
runners.comment: Point winner, no impact in five starts over hurdles, tongue tie on, others more likely
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner hasn't cut much ice in five starts over hurdles; well-beaten in first two handicaps and tongue tie now added to cheekpieces; others preferred.

runners.name: Hard Target
runners.comment: Last won in December 2022 off 7lb lower, didn't show enough on latest to fancy here
runners.spotlight: 1-23 over hurdles but that win came all the way back in December 2022; remains 7lb above that win and didn't show enough to make him of interest here on his return from a break over 19.5f here last month.

runners.name: West Of Carrig
runners.comment: Five-time point winner, beaten fav' over 3m1f off this mark latest, drop in trip a plus
runners.spotlight: Five-time point-to-point winner; 0-10 over hurdles and was a beaten 7-2 favourite off this mark at Tipperary earlier this month over 3m1f (gd-yld), racing too keenly and not getting home; this shorter trip should suit better and he could go well.

runners.name: Younowhatimean
runners.comment: 0-8 over timber, ran ok at Musselburgh in Nov', unseated early in chase latest, needs more
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; 0-14 under Rules and 0-8 over hurdles; best effort a 3.5l third of 15 at Ballinrobe last July off 1lb lower; unseated early in beginners' chase latest; shaped okay on last start in this sphere at Musselburgh in November but needs more to win.

runners.name: Jekiki
runners.comment: 0-9 over timber, not a bad run latest on second start for this yard, longer trip a query
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden over hurdles; one of better efforts when a 6.25l fifth of 12 at Clonmel on latest (19.5f, good) on second start for this yard; not sure this longer trip will suit.

runners.name: Mother Ship
runners.comment: 0-8, ran well off this mark at Tramore on penultimate, place chance if repeating that
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles; best effort an 11l second of 11 behind Our Zebo off this mark at Tramore last month but didn't build on that behind the same rival latest (reportedly clipped heels); place chance if repeating that Tramore effort.

runners.name: Dragons Pass

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late P E I Newell

runners.comment: No win since November 2023, blinkers return, mark sliding but others preferred
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; three-time winner over hurdles but losing run stretches back to November 2023; hasn't looked like ending her barren run on recent starts; blinkers return and handicapper giving a chance but others hold more pressing claims.

quotes.race: Ballagh Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dragons Pass is a really tough mare and always does her best. I have wanted to keep her for the real winter ground. That was a step up for her and showed that she was well able for it - Denise Foster, trainer

quotes.race: BetVictor Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was a little bit unexpected. This is the first time she's gone that distance and it looks like she's crying out for it. She really tried out there, she likes that ground and now I know what trip to run her over. We'll keep her going over the winter now that we know she likes heavy ground. I'm delighted for the owners as they've been very good supporters of mine for many a year - Denise Foster, trainer of Dragon's Pass

runners.name: Neska Blue
runners.comment: 0-4, beaten 18l on handicap debut latest at Cork, 1lb lower, blinkers on, needs more time
runners.spotlight: 0-4 over hurdles; best effort in maidens a 16.5l seventh at Wexford; beaten a similar distance when outpaced on handicap debut latest at Cork (24.5f, good); down 1lb and blinkers added but may need more time.

runners.name: Kiln Time

runners.spotlight: Won for the third time at Naas in April off 81 (3m, gd-yld); decent run off revised mark at Cork without looking like winning; similar effort in handicap chase at Wexford latest; has won off this rating on testing ground so rain may enhance his chance.

runners.name: Southgate Avenue
runners.comment: Maiden, beaten 44l on latest over 3m, down in trip and 5lb lower but hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden has not progressed in handicaps; jumping an issue at times and beaten 44l on latest at Wexford (3m, good); down 5lb and in trip but hard to fancy.

runners.name: Hitthehayson

runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles; best effort three starts ago when an 11.5l fifth of 13 at Clonmel (18.5f, good); 4lb lower now after poor runs at Tramore and Down Royal; step up in trip needs to transform.

runners.spotlight: Two-time chase winner is 0-28 over hurdles; ran well over bigger obstacles at Thurles in November but well-beaten over timber when last seen at Cork in December; veteran entitled to need this run after a break.

runners.name: Rideau Canal
runners.comment: 0-15 over hurdles, beaten 58l and jumped poorly latest at Kilbeggan, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; 0-19 under Rules and 0-15 over hurdles; has regressed since promising third at Sligo (20.5f, soft) in August of last year; always behind and jumping not fluent on latest at Kilbeggan when beaten 58l; hard to fancy.

runners.name: Da Big Fella
runners.comment: Running well over fences recently, place chance if as effective back over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Veteran without a win since July 2021; has been knocking on the door in recent starts over fences; beaten 3.25l on latest off 73 in a handicap chase at Wexford (19.5f, yielding); place chance if as effective back over hurdles for the first time since February 2023.

quotes.race: Dawn Hi + Lo Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Da Big Fella is one we bred ourselves. He showed ability at home but not much on the track, he is crying out for a fence - Eamon Courtney, trainer.

runners.name: Mags Nelson
runners.comment: Stayed on nicely on handicap bow at Cork (2m4f), step up in trip a plus, chance; reserve

runners.name: Cosmo Renfro
runners.comment: Two-time course winner, best on testing ground, pulled up two of last four starts; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; two-time hurdles winner at this track; best on heavy; last success came over 2m3f in April 2024 on testing ground; 1lb lower now but pulled up in two of last four starts; needs the ground to soften considerably.

runners.name: Sydney Cruiser
runners.comment: 0-16 over hurdles, poor twice since promising run at Navan, needs a revival; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 0-16 over hurdles; shaped well at Navan in April when staying on for fourth of 18 over 2m (gd-yld) off 3lb higher; poor twice since, however; needs a revival.

runners.spotlight: 8,500euros 3yo; fifth foal; sister to bumper and 2m1f-2m6f hurdle winner Ballybawn Belter, half-sister to 2m4f/2m5f hurdle winner Western Knight; dam unplaced in bumpers; unlikely to provide the answer.

runners.name: Atomic Queen

runners.spotlight: Dropped out to be beaten just under 60l in a Galway bumper last September; did go off at 8-1 so perhaps better was expected of her.

runners.name: Barra Rua

runners.name: Bearami Creek

runners.name: Champagne Melanie
runners.comment: Tailed off in bumpers here and at Sligo, when 150-1 and 66-1 respectively
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in bumpers here and at Sligo, when 150-1 and 66-1 respectively.

runners.name: Clash Of Wings
runners.comment: Eighth foal; dam unraced half-sister to smart 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase winner Invictus
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; dam unraced half-sister to smart 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase winner Invictus; trainer doesn't have many bumper runners but saddles two here, both newcomers.

runners.spotlight: Dam unraced half-sister to winners Emerging Talent (useful bumper/2m1f-2m4f hurdle) and Ardera Ru (2m4f-2m6f hurdle/chase); stable 0-11 in bumpers during recent seasons; jockey booking heightens interest.

runners.name: Crokes Cross

runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 2m4f hurdle winner Southern Babylon; dam unraced sister to 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Flaming Charmer; likely best watched on belated debut.

runners.name: Duel Concept
runners.comment: 66-1 when tailed off here in March having been out the back throughout
runners.spotlight: 66-1 when tailed off here in March having been out the back throughout.

runners.name: Forty Kay
runners.breeder: Mickley Stud, F Ellis & Mr & Mrs Dawson
runners.comment: £11,000 3yo; ninth foal; half-sister to a Flat winner in Cyprus; dam 1m4f winner
runners.spotlight: £11,000 3yo; ninth foal; half-sister to a Flat winner in Cyprus; dam 1m4f winner (RPR 89), closely related to Racing Post Trophy/Dante winner Dilshaan; obvious contender for the champion trainer.

runners.name: Nells Princess
runners.comment: 2,500euros 3yo; half-sister to winners in points and under rules; stable runs two
runners.spotlight: 2,500euros 3yo; fourth foal; half-sister to winners It's Hard To Know (point and 2m3f/2m4f hurdle) and Look At Mee (point); dam unraced sister to bumper winner Active Force; stable also runs Clash Of Wings.

runners.name: Subpoena

runners.spotlight: First foal out of a 2m hurdle winner, out of unraced half-sister to 2m5f-3m2f hurdle/chase winner Merry Path; hooded for debut.

quotes.race: McEnery Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Phoenix Cowboy is a horse that we thought wanted plenty of cut but he loved that ground. He will get further and hopefully get into a premier handicap now - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Ballykinlar

runners.spotlight: Maiden point-to-pointer has shown mild promise in two of his three maiden hurdles, including over C&D (soft); opening mark doesn't look overly generous; best watched on handicap debut.

runners.name: Quinn The Eskimo
runners.comment: Won on latest, raised 7lb and upped in trip, unexposed in h'caps, may be more to come
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the fifth attempt on latest at Down Royal (17.5f, good) earlier this month off 85; raised 7lb for that and steps up in trip; unexposed in handicaps and could be more to come.

runners.name: Smackwater Jack
runners.comment: Winless since 2019, went close off 3lb lower latest, go well if ground turns testing

stable_tour.quote: He had a very good start over fences at Aintree but has missed 18 months. He's back in good form now and we'll start in a handicap chase with him in about six weeks. He could become a very nice staying chaser. 27-10-22

runners.name: Lucky Junior

runners.name: Klassman
runners.comment: 0-14, good run on penultimate, pulled up over 3m latest, drop in trip a plus, place chance
runners.spotlight: 0-14 over hurdles; good effort on penultimate at Ballinrobe (21.5f, good) last month when a 2l third of 15; pulled up at Kilbeggan latest over 3m (yielding); drop in trip a plus and cheekpieces discarded; place chance.

runners.name: Highland Earl
runners.comment: 0-6, held by Tir Og on Sligo run latest, down another 3lb but a lot more needed
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles and yet to trouble the judge; held by Tir Og on Sligo run latest; dropped 3lb but needs much more.

runners.name: Hero In The Sky
runners.comment: Point winner, weakened quickly latest at Clonmel, held by Silas Mariner on that form
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; 0-5 over hurdles; ran well to a point on latest at Clonmel (19.5f, good) but weakened quickly; held by Silas Mariner on that form; others preferred.

runners.name: Tea It Is

runners.name: Galilean Prince
runners.comment: Handicap debutant, poor form in maidens, steps up in trip, best watched unless backed
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure odds and never figured in three maiden hurdles; best watched upped in trip on handicap debut unless the market suggests otherwise.

runners.name: Hay Baby

stable_tour.quote: I don't think there's been a single juvenile winner in her family, so we know she'll get better with age. She still achieved a bit last year - probably the most a juvenile from her family has - and I'm looking forward to her. I hope she's on a favourable mark and can take on the family and win races at three as she goes up in trip. 11-04-24
